text:
Trying something new.
 My first time here. Won't be my last. Super yummy food and great atmosphere. This will definitely be one of the top places to come to for dinner from now on.

The place looks OK,friendly people but food is horrible...
I don't think we'll be coming back...

Short version of this review: If I can give zero star, I would. Please don't waste your time and money to come here.
Long version of this review: I made a yelp account just to write this review. This is the worst taste I've ever had in a restaurant. I ordered Spicy Tonkotsu Miso Ramen, the broth tastes decent but the bamboo shoots taste horrible and smells gross. They don't taste fresh, they taste like canned bamboo shoots you can buy at China Town. The thing that upsets me most was the Buta Shio Bukkake. My girlfriend ordered it and it was nothing but udon noodles in clear soup with three extremely thin slices of burned grill pork and three sticks of green onion. The soup tastes like boiled water with oil and burned smells, and the worst thing is that it costs $9! I will attach pictures at the end of the review. It was so bad that I had to ask the server to take it back. The restaurant let me order something else instead. I ordered Chicken Karage Don, which tastes blahhh at best. The chicken tastes so bland and the miso soup that came with it tastes horrible. The tofu in the miso soup tastes like it hasn't been washed prior to cooking. I don't understand how they can serve food that tastes so bad to customers and charge this price. It's ridiculous.
Overall, definitely avoid this restaurant at all costs if you don't want to ruin your appetite and waste your time and money. I would not even eat the food there again even for free.

The food was decent. Dining area was pretty clean. That's the only reason I'm giving this review a two star. The roaring music the employees play are explicit and very offensive. The kind one should be listening using a headset or played at a rave party. Not a place to take children, family, aunts, uncle, grandparents, or even discuss respectable business. Regardless if a restaurant is $ or $$$$, background music should not be inappropriate. The content of lyrics played during a late lunch with my 12 yr olds twins were obscene, indecent and profane. The owner should have a sign on the door about their inappropriate music so children or anyone  who wishes not to be an audience to this type of surrounding can opt out. This place seem to be overpowered by a group of young careless inadequate staff. Is it recommendable? I wouldn't put my name recommending this place, there plenty ramen places that are worth earning your business like Ramen Kobo on Durango/215.

Food was good but check your receipts.  When the check came, it wasn't itemized. When my husband asked for a copy he noticed the gratuity was already added. He then said, "Oh, I didn't know the gratuity was already added."  The cashier said, "You didn't ask."  Walked back to the table and removed what would've been an extra tip. This place would've gotten five stars if they didn't try to pull a fast one on us. And no it was not posted anywhere that gratuity is automatically added.

The only reason I didn't give it one star is because it is priced to value. You get a big portion of appetizers and such for the price that you pay; but who wants a lot of a bad thing anyway? I had the ramen and I would say it was under par; if you want good ramen in Las Vegas, go to Monta Ramen. 

My boyfriend had the steak don and it was dry and flavorless. The miso soup is obviously packaged as I actually eat the same brand at home so I'm certain on that.

Food was good. I had a tonkatsu ramen and it was very flavorful without being too heavy. The service was very good as well. 

Only thing i think that could be better is the portion size. It was decent, but it left me wanting for just a little bit more.

Great service, surprisingly unique and charming decor, the 2-top tables/seats were undersized; more like the size for an ice cream table/chairs, but plenty of other choices. I had noodle bowl, boyfriend had a steak dish, both were excellent! Do yourself a favor and try it out.

Such a cute place with good vibes. I love the decor and this is now probably tied with itsy bitsy ramen for my favorite ramen place in town! The shishito peppers are amazing, and their seaweed salad in unlike any other I've ever had! So unique!

cute decor, service was speedy and refills on beverages was constant. I had the Ton Katsu Don with curry, the portion was excellent and I left the restauraunt feeling very satisfied and content. Their pan seared pork gyoza, although the portion was small, was nice and crispy and worth every penny!
I was excited to hear that a ramen joint is near . The service is good but the time it took for my food to come out was ridiculous . You are better off eating ramen on spring mountain such as sora .
Great food and great service. Couldn't ask for anything more. We will be back soon. Loved there spicy miso ramen and beef was great.

I love this place but for one reason. The spicy tonkotsu is phenomenal. I order it every time and it's perfect each time. I have had a few appetizers and the fried rice and they were average at best. This is why I'm giving 3 stars. I would recommend the tonkotsu ramen and the spicy version if you like heat. Great broth and delicious pork. I like the ramen here better than monta in las vegas but overall monta wins out for service and better overall menu.

First off, I wanna say I love the decor in this place. It's a Japan city in a restaurant. They've only been opened for less than a week so the place is a complete mess and disorganized. We literally waited for 25 minutes for our ramen to come out and it wasn't even that good. I'd rather wait 45 minutes at Monta to get seated and eat some good ramen. 

The kitchen was so backed up. They brought one of the appetizers we ordered and it was wrong so I sent it back. They gave us a complimentary vegetable tempura for the messed up. I kept on hearing the servers apologizing for their kitchen being backed up but yet the servers couldn't keep up cleaning the tables, waiting on the tables, and serving the customers which I didn't understand when there's 5 of them and since there's no food coming out of the kitchen. Our ramen finally came out 25 minutes later but we still never got the wrong appetizer that I had sent back and the other appetizer we have ordered. I might give them a chance months down the road if their service improves.

Finally there is a ramen restaurant opened in the southwest area. I don't have to drive all the way to Chinatown for a bowl of ramen. Food was delicious especially the tempura, service was good, place is clean, nice decorates and the prices are reasonable. Omoide also serves beer and sake.  I will come back.
our favorite place for poke!!! I really like eating here and I like the decorations. The service is really good too!!!

I've been here a couple times with my boyfriend. We get a bowl of ramen and the curry katsu and split the entrees between us. The portions are good, and they also have delicious buns. 

Four stars because I've had better ramen and katsu elsewhere, but it's still good, and the price is not bad either.

When I come here it's usually at happy hour so I can get another pint of beer free. One Kirin Ichiban can equal to Two right after. I love comjng here to eat. The decor inside is pretty interesting and unique. They have paper lanterns hanging from the ceiling. The staff are attentive to my needs so service is great when I come. It does sadden me that their portion sizes have become smaller and the prices stayed the same. Overall this is a cool place to dine at. Umeboshi Onigiri all the way!!The Don bowls and Ramen are great too! I will be continuing to come here after a hard day of work that's for sure.

A ramen restaurant near home is always good, especially with the cold weather. Great deal for lunch $12 (ramen + side dish + drink).
Some ramen spots are so oily and with fatty charsu but that wasn't the case here.  Flavorful and perfect serving size.  Didn't feel as if it was full of msg. 
I'm glad I don't need to drive to Spring Mtn to get my ramen fix.

I really like this place! Solid little izakaya in the South West that serves reasonably priced food with good happy-hour specials. I typically try the noodle dishes -- which are really good every time I've ordered -- but the sushi, onigiri, and everything else i've had has been excellent. This is a super casual place with a friendly staff and a decent ambiance that you should check out next time you're in the mood for Japanese food.

I adore this place when you first walking it has a great theme love the vibes here and I loved the spicy tonkotsu but best part about this place was our waitress she was so sweet and kind explained everything very well so if you come here ask for Ada she's wonderful !!!
I was disappointed by their noodless. The menu pictures are very misleading. Most of it was bland.
Love the miso tonkatsu shisito peppers and garlic edamame, our server always was around to make sure our meal was pleasant ...definitely coming back

Decor: Very cute! They had something visually interesting in every corner and the ceiling. 
Layout: I hate the entrance!  Open the doors to tables. Customers (including myself) stop at the entrance looking left and right for the hostess stand. There is none.
Food: I only had the zaru soba (cold buckwheat noodle) and a Calpico.  So it's hard to judge the quality of food based on an easy dish. I guess I'll say it was acceptable.
Service: Servers were polite and there were no long waiting periods.
Menu: OMG There are so many different types of Japanese food on this menu I wonder what they can handle it.  One order could be ramen and the next could be a katsudon. The cook(s) have to be really talented to switch gears like that. Finally, I found several misspellings on the menu.  I addressed it to the server and he said he will pass it along to the manager.
Overall, it was fine.  I live close by so I will most likely visit again.

Went to try out this place with a friend of mine since this is a brand new restaurant from the group that owns Soyo and Oyshi in the lot.  Like both restaurants, Omoide has a plain exterior and a beautifully decorated interior.  Unlike Soyo and Oyshi tho, I think Omoide needs some work on their food.  I ordered the Karaage chicken but it was a bit dry and tough to eat.  My friend ordered their cold soba noodles.  I normally don't like soba noodles since they tend to taste funny out here in Vegas whenever I've ordered, but his was surprisingly good. If they spend their time tweaking with the menu by specializing just a little more, I think Omoide could become a gem of a restaurant like her sisters Soyo and Oyshi.

My wife and I came here  for a later dinner on a Friday night. This place would get minus stars if Yelp would allow it. We walked in and were seated quickly but everything went downhill from here. It took a few minutes just to be acknowledged and drink orders taken. I ordered a udon bowl and the wifey ordered a donkatsu plate. After waiting an eternity my food finally came out first. It didn't just taste like instant udon but I think this is what they were really serving. Flavorless, soggy shrimp tempura, and one small fish cake. I finished my food and my wife never got hers. I asked the waitress if her food was on its way and she apologized and said she would check on it. She didn't give us an update and came back 10 minutes later with the food. When we were done it was another unacceptable wait to request and receive the check. It was a crappy experience overall and we won't be back to this place.
New fresh vibe, decor, and food. With all the bowl places, this one really takes it up a notch. Loved it. Great food great service.

I wanna give 4 stars to this cozy restaurant. I think people are a little harsh ? Have you tried their karaage with curry powder or katsudon ? I'm from Japan and they taste pretty authentic. I love this place. If you never been to this place, give it a chance. If you haven't been here in a while, give this place another chance. When I come here, I rarely order ramen. I recommend other items on the menu. Now they serve poke-bowl, LA style. A lot of things have improved. The servers are friendly and polite. I will definitely repeat.

Ive been waiting for this place to open. Nice menu with a bit of everything. Its only their soft opening so i can understand the confusion with the menu. Overall just what the southwest needed. No need to go to spring mnt. anymore.

We get take out from here a great deal and we have never been disappointed. The noodles are authentic and they give you a nice selection to choose from. Our son loves ramen but he has become used to the packaged bowls - this place has helped him develop his palette and be more adventurous. No complaints with the 'to go' service.

It was an ok Japanese place. It was great but it wasn't bad either. The place is ok, the ambiance was just alright. The servers were nice and try to give you the best service ASAP. The good was ok, I ordered the Spicy Tonkatsu shoyo ramen. The flavor was right, I have tried numerous Japanese places and to compare their ramen, I would say it is average. The price is ok for what you get but I feel that charged too much for gratuity, their service was ok but I felt that they charged as too much for that and there was only 5 of us when we ate their..so that's for that.

Oh, that chicken curry was hands down the best! My husband and I are very happy and satisfied with this place! The food is very delicious! I had the thick ramen noodle and by far the best I've ever had. 

THANK YOU OMOIDE STAFF! Our compliments to the chef!
Good food Late night snack with the buy one get one free beer! It hits the spot. Service was good with fast output on food.
Had a late lunch. Shrimp Tempura Udon was great, price was ok for the size of the bowl.
Horrible service. We waited for a long time. Waitress was nice, but our food took almost 40 min for it to come. Food was not worth the wait.

This place is delicious. Chicken/karrage is flame. Rib eye don cooked medium rare was spot on and tender . Eggs and chasu sides were good. Service is great. Deserves a solid 5 stars

Reading some of the reviews I think people are just expecting something else. For what this place is suppose to be, it's

I love love love this restaurant. We have been here multiple times with no change in quality of service or the food. They serve traditional Japanese fare with huge portions at a decent price. If you haven't been here before, I would recommend coming during their lunch special which is so yummy and affordable- you'll also get a good sampling of what they have to offer. Also, it's worth mentioning that the decor of the restaurant is so cool and totally adds to the ambiance of the place.

Omoide Noodles and Bowls is a nice little Japanese noodle house, with attractive Japanese decor, and very tasty food.  I ordered the Tonkotsu Shoyu lunch special, with an order of Gyoza, and a iced green tea.  The bowl was amazing!  The mushroomy broth was so good I drank out of the bowl what I couldn't get with the spoon.  The ramen was cooked perfectly, and the little mushrooms were very good as well.  The Pork Chashu bowl on the side was a very pleasant surprise, and was bursting with flavor.  It was like little slices of pork belly that fall apart in your mouth with a gingery soy flavor, which seeps through to the rice underneath.  The little salad that came with the dish was light and tasty as well.  Speaking to the customer service, I ordered a second lunch combo for my son who was going to meet me there, and because my son was late, the staff was kind enough to offer to make a new dish for him so that it would be nice and hot when he arrived, which was very much appreciated.  I will DEFINITELY recommend Omoide to friends, and I will also be back again soon.

Bad service ever!
I love this place, I love their food, always good service, but today was horrible!
the server who are working opening sheet today, she was so rude!
why she shift responsibility on the customer?
she keep charge for her mistake even we said several time when we placed an order.
she seems she don't have any knowledge about menu and common sense at all!

I asked to my husband to call them to make an order and pick up.
He keep saying Not a ton katsu-don, we want to only ton katsu! but she can't understand. I thought she barely understand English. 
Anyway when my husband pick the order, she give him donkatsu-don, so my husband explain about we want donkatsu, not a donkatsu-don.
and guess what she saying?
"Next time say order king tonkatus".

and we have to pay for tonkatsu-don too.
It was her mistake I can't still understand why we have to pay for their mistake? and why this restaurant owner hire that kind of stupid server?
If she are under training that the reason why she don't know about all the menu, they need to put another one to teach her.

This is one of my go to spot for dinner every week. They have a nice decor and I would say their food is excellent and most important pricing is very fair. Service is good except they should fix their main door. You need to have extra strength in order to open the heavy door of theirs.

Atmosphere: more modern Japanese ramen house, clean, cool Japanese music

Food: had the spicy tonkatsu with extra corn and seaweed. Hella good and hella filling. Can be shareable if u do appetizers too. My only grip is it could be a bit more spicy.

Service: fast and friendly!

Every single thing here was so delicious! Came here with my cousins and we pretty much tried everything on the menu. Service was excellent and the honey toast was an absolute must have (it's huge!) !! Definitely check this place out, super glad I have a great ramen place nearby now!

Just ate there for the first time before Thanksgiving.  Ive been back 3 times since.  It's cozy and the soups are fantastic.  Great for date night, super cheap and full of flavor.  Plus on Weds they have a happy hour BOGO on drinks!!!!!  Thats two 16oz. Beers for $4.50 and 2 Medium size bottles of Sake for $12 Awesomeness!!!! Go eat there, I'll be the dude in the corner smiling and laughing with joy and happiness while sipping Ramen broth and chop sticking my way to enlightenment.
First time and I'm impressed with the ambiance servers are courteous i was really disappointed with one or two stars those people had negative spirit. I hate those people.

I just moved here not that long ago, I didn't really had the chance to look for a ramen spot but found this spot near where I lived and I'm pretty satisfied with it. Coming from the island where ramen is a competition lol. Overall I like it and if I find another then so be it, I'm still a return customer here regardless.

Friendly service, good but not great ramen, udon, and some other foods.  I would recommend Omoide if you live in the southwest.  Sometimes it is too far to go to Fukumimi on Trop and Eastern,and Omoide is solid.  The big negative is the lack of consistency in the cooks/chef's.  They take too long, harldy the same people each time I go, and for that I almost dropped it to a 3 star but the friendly service countered the slow cook times.
We loveeeee this restaurant! The quality of food is always on point and the service is great!!

The broth was good. The bamboo shoots that came with it were very delicious. I am trying to eat low carb and asked for extra bamboo with no noodle and the accommodated. 5 stars would have been given for more meat but for the price everything was a great value. We will be back.

As a vegetarian it's hard for me to compare this to other ramen spots. While I read that other places have better, I have to say that this place stands out because they actually have a veggie option. A veggie option with actual flavor!! It's spicy miso and not just a bland veggie broth like what most places offer (if they offer veggie at all). Also their green iced tea is great too. Staff is very attentive and everything is timely. I love it.

We had the Shrimp Tempura Udon and Tonkatsu Shoyu. Also the Gyoza.  It was all just a little below average.  The staff was very nice.  No alcohol yet.  We will not be going back... We will be going to our favorite PHO place instead... I approve this message J K KUHL...

The food and price weren't bad, and they have a huge selection, but it really wasn't all that tasty. I've had ramen at a few other places, and this one scored pretty much smack dab in the middle. Not bad, but also not something I'd remember. The chashu was really chewy and tough compared to the melt in your mouth chashu I usually get in ramen and the tonkotsu broth was a little on the thin side. 

Still, a pretty decent meal and establishment overall.

Suck customer service!! Very suck!!! It's a place that you never wanna go back to suffer such customer services!!!  Terrible place! Server are terrible!! Have you ever see a server yelling on a customer? Do you want to argue with a server? If not, you should always avoid this place! Go other place instead.
This is my first time eating here. I fall in love with the food and everyone here are nice. I just love Japanese food and the they have a food Challenge like giant tonkotsu.
Open late and have a buy 1 get 1 beer and sake special. Interior is very nice. Customer service is great. Good vibes

I like coming to Omoide because it's near my house and their food is decent. But, my experience today wasn't so hot. We ordered to-go and had to wait 30 minutes for just two bowls. When we got home with our food, I wasn't pleased to find that they forgot the sauce for one of our bowls and the tonkatsu was too hard (probably fried too long) for the other bowl.

I love this place! The tonkatsu is the best base in town so far. I love the spicy tonkatsu and the chashu is always excellent. I would highly recommend this place as because it is fantastic. I did take a friend there that doesn't do carbs, and they pretty much have nothing for non carb eaters. Just saying! However, great service and excellent food quality makes this place fantastic for my lunch spot.

New chef? New Management? This couldn't possibly be the same place we used to rely on for tasty food and great service.
After reading a previous yelper recommend the sautéed mushrooms, I had to give them a try. Disappointing would be an understatement... They were doused in a whole stick of butter - completely inedible! We had to send them back. 
When our server presented our check he apologized for the mushrooms and offered Mochi ice cream "on the house." While we appreciated the gesture, what we didn't understand is why he wouldn't remove the mushrooms from our check. Why would we pay for something we were unable to eat!?
2 stars because the Tofu steak was quite good and I'm hoping this was just an "off" night. But, I'm still going to have a difficult time convincing my husband to return.

Was having a New Year's Eve dinner with family. Placed my order first and got it last. I ordered the Beef Steak Don and it states the meat used is short ribs. When it finally came out after everyone was almost done with their meals, the meat wasn't even short ribs. I told the server that I ordered the short ribs and he said that they don't have short ribs. We asked to see the menu to see where the mistake was and right under the Beef Steak Don it says Beef Short Rib. He asked if we wanted to switch it out for something else and I end up ordering Tempura bowl. 5 mins later he comes back with another disappointment.. they just dumped and cleaned the fryer. It's safe to say I will not be back and will not recommend!

I was craving katsu curry and was hoping I could try this place out for the first time... but when I called and asked if they offer chicken katsu instead of pork (because I don't eat pork), the woman said "no."  Just... "no."  So my question is.... WHY NOT?  I mean, chicken katsu is not some off-the-wall request.  Most restaurants that serve katsu give you the option.  I might've still tried the place out if she'd been more willing to suggest other options or even if she just lied and pretended to ask the kitchen if they'd make an accommodation, but she didn't.  She just said "no."  Okay, thanks for your lack of effort. I guess I won't make the effort either.

Beyond thrilled to have a ramen shop in Southwest!  Can't tell you how many times we have dreaded the drive to Jinya / Monta but couldn't live without Ramen!  

The decor is so adorable with Japanese accents. The restaurant only had a few patrons when we arrived, but my daughter spotted a couple of seats at their bar, so that's where we enjoyed our first Omoide meal. :)

Menus were "served" on clipboards.  Extensive menu for a little place!  I had a hard time deciding what to order, but being that it was an unusually cold day in May, I knew I wanted a hot bowl of noodles!  Although I was excited to try the ramen, I ordered the Shrimp Tempura Udon and my daughter ordered the Tonkatsu Miso Ramen (I knew she would be able to spare a few bites for me to try their ramen noodles as well).  We also had the garlic edamame appetizer.  Everything was really delicious and plated (bowled) beautifully!  Our soup was not super hot which was a little disappointing, but not enough for us to send it back. We ate it anyway and honestly we were both very happy (and full) with our meal!  

Of course their service was a little scattered, which is expected of a new restaurant on only its second day of business, but I'll be back to check them out after they've had more time to get used to their own menu + perfect their service. 

Nonetheless, EXCITED to have a solid noodle option a few blocks from my house. Woohoo!

I love this place service is very fast everyone here is friendly! I'm from Hawaii and my mom is from japan so I miss having real comfort Japanese food. I had the katsu don and my bf had the ebi don, so delicious! Will be coming here more often wish it was a bit closer to my home!
~Some Pre Dinner Asian Inspired Cocktails... Yumminess!!! This is a great place even just to grab a cocktail and their food is also amazing I love their lunch I'll be back

Okay at best. Service was okay. Food was okay.

We came in for an evening snack. We were seated promptly. Waters were refilled at a decent rate and server was nice.

On to food. Beef tataki didn't stand out. Didn't get any sweetness or aroma from the garlic chips. The beef lacked savoriness, which made the acid stand our a bit much. The corn cheese was also okay. A bit of sweetness from the corn, but the cheese didn't impart any addition. The buta shio soba didn't really add up either. The soba was great, the pepper puree was great, even the grilled pork was great. The broth however was a little funky and didn't impart much. Two things that did stand out, however, were the chashu bowl and the croquette. The chashu bowl was melt in your mouth great. With the addition of umeboshi, the bowl left a satisfying feeling. The croquette was crunchy on the outside and soft on the inside (get this).

For dessert, get the black sesame ice cream. It was good.

Overall: Okay. Wouldn't go back anytime soon though.

The ambience is perfect.. Feels like the typical ramen place down Chinatown. Prices are reasonable. Tonkotsu ramen is $7.50 I think and gyoza 5pcs is $5. Good sized portions. The chashu is not as tender as monta ramen, but it's still good. Customer service is excellent! Going back next week!

When it comes to dining out, great food, price, and atmosphere is what you hope to get. Well, you'll get that at Omoide. 

The last time I visited Omoide Noodles was in July. They were a relatively new spot on the block. the biggest gripe I had at that time was that there was not enough noodles in the soups. Well, they fixed that! 

I had the Pumpkin Croquette as an appetizer again and it was just as I remembered. It is a crunchy tempera style pumpkin cake with a dipping sauce.

Then I had the Spicy Tonkotsu Ramen with egg and he had the Miso Tonkotsu Ramen. Trust me the Spicy Tonkotsu tastes much better than it sounds. They have a spicy version and a regular Miso Tonkotsu for those that don't want to drink a lot of water with their soup. I've heard other's say it isn't spicy - well then they must have also changed that. It was spicy this time around.

It was a pleasant experience. I am always happy when I return to find things have improved. They have increased in a star - 4 stars now!

1st timer here. Any ramen spot I always look for karaage chicken and order tonkatsu ramen. And this place is def on par with the best! Their karaage chicken def reminds me of my childhood in Japan and their spicy tonkatsu ramen was delicious -- though the next time I come back I'll have to double the meat. But other than their food, the ambience and interior design of this restaurant is awesome. Definitely a nice date spot.

Security and visit and I had the shishito peppers to start. Just the right amount of heat and a nice tangy sauce. I had the chashu don which is a pork belly roll with a mild sweet sauce served over rice. It includes a miso soup, side salad, and some pickles. It was all really good. The atmosphere is so comfortable and the staff has always been so friendly and attentive. Definitely coming back again.
This place is great!  Reminds me of my days living in Japan as a exchange student.  Food quality and service is awesome and very fair reasonable prices!

The premiere Don place in Las Vegas. If you want your fix of Asian rice bowls (specifically Japanese), then this is the place to go.

Don't bother with the noodles. They're ok. 

You're here for the Gyudon, the Karaage Don, the Katsu Curry and the Chashu bowl. 

Their appetizers are great too. Order the Karaage, the potato croquette, and the Takoyaki,

Excellent Food, Excellent Interior, Attentive Servers, Reasonable Price, Amazing portions.

5/5

Omoide is one of those restaurants that makes you feel like you're in Japan without trying hard to be Japanese. I was a little suspect upon first walking in, as the outside looks like it could be a fast food place with a drive through, however was pleasantly surprised upon entering; It was a casual sit down restaurant.

The Service and is wonderful and the place was decorated nicely! My friend and I had the tonkatsu curry don, chicken karaage don and the potato korokke . They were good, not stand out fantastic, but got the job done.  Best part was the happy hour special they had, where the Sake was buy one get one free.  

Overall, I'd come back to try something else on the menu, but mostly because the service was fantastic. 

Yay, Omoide! I'll be back...

Came here on a whim after seeing a friend's post.

I had the tonkatsu shoyu ramen, karaage, & green tea ice cream.

everything was pretty good. I really enjoyed the mayo in ponzu sauce for the karaage & green tea ice cream. I guess my personal preference for ramen is more on the salty side, which the ramen wasn't as I'd hope. The decor was awesome, they made it like you were in japan. Service was quick & polite.

Giving four stars for a very excellent lunch special! The lunch special is $12, with your choice of ramen or udon, a second plate of either chasu bowl, fried rice, or chicken curry, house salad, and a beverage of your choice. The portion was plentiful ( enough for two people if you divvy it up), and delicious.

Ramen was decent, the meat was a little on the tougher on the side, and the broth was fair. Curry with rice was good. I left happy and satisfied for the price and meal.

A new ramen place in town & close to my work so had to check it out over lunch one Friday. Only about 4 other diners in the venue upon arrival around 1:15pm. And it wasn't an extraordinarily hot day. Music was too loud we had to ask them to turn it down so we didn't have to shout at each other. They obliged. Ordered the traditional Tonkotsu. It was good even though I put way too much chili oil in it. The server was extremely nice & gave me more broth to add to my bowl because there was no way I could eat it that spicy. I think I like Monta Chaya a bit better. But it's nice to have a ramen place on the SW side of town now & in the winter months that's where I'll be for lunch from time to time.
place is nice. my daughter loved their onigiri. the cold noodle is a bit hard. but will come back to try their hot ramen.

This was a good place for lunch. It has a lot of choices on the menu. But for the ramen it was just ok. The broth wasnt tasty like other places. And the noodles are alittle weird. Next time ill try something else on the menu.

this place just had soft opening
great menu
reasonable price
i went there twice alrealdy

first time
the food took little long but worth waiting for
second time
food came out faster and better organized!!!

Place is GREAT. Unique decor intimate casual dining. $8-$9 for a wonderful flavored pork rice bowl, brought out on a tray just for you with a cup of miso soup & small salad. To kick it up a notch we were served lovely pieces of pickled radish & cucumber in bright color. While the flavor stood on its own without extras, we added spicy chili oil for a drop of heat. It was delightful & reasonably priced making a filling & flavorful meal. The waitress was friendly, efficient, and helpful in suggesting popular meals. We also learned this franchise is from the same owners who have brought Oishe Sushi, Sparklings, and a few other great restaurants to this Southwest corner of Vegas. Keep up the great offerings! Total bill including 2 dinners, 1 large saki, tax & tip $34

This place just opened up near our house. I love ramen noodles and my gf loves tempura, so we decided to stop by for lunch. The location is easy to find and parking isn't an issue. We were treated nicely by the young kids running the place. 

We started out with Pan fired dumpling and the our chosen dishes that I previously mentioned. The shrimp tempura came in quickly. However I had to wait 10-15 minutes before my Ramen was delivered. 

Tempura shrimp with curry was alright. Lacked proper breaking and the curry was too thick.

Ramen broth was nice but expect very small amount of noodles, so order extra noodles if u are hungry. Dumpling were good, same as other places. 

Overall it a good place to get ramen in south west if you don't want to drive to Chinatown. But I'd rather go to Sora or Tonkotsu Kiyoshi for my Japanese fix.

First time we came we got the Zaru (cold noodles and Katsu Don. Pretty good and light.

Today was a little busier. We ordered the Buta Shio with soba noodles (grilled pork belly udon) and Kake (basic udon). The Buta Shio was really, really light. We asked for an extra order of the grilled pork but they couldn't do it (?). It was not worth $9. There were four little thin pieces of pork. My udon was good. It's hard to mess up udon. 

Today was different. There's 4 dirty tables around us...too much work for two people. Witnessed 4 walkouts! Yikes. 

We'll come back. Maybe when it's not so busy.
This place is super cute has great service and food  idk why more people don't come here. Such a hidden gem!

I finally got to try this place out last night. When I walked in, the decor was very cute - very japan lol I instantly realized that this was where rice trax used to be. Anyways, we were instantly greeted with a smile and got a table in the corner like we wanted. The menu is very simple. There were some things on the menu that I needed a translator for. The waitress kindly and patiently told us what we wanted to know. We opted for the rice ball things - one with beef in it and the other with crab in it. Both very good and remind me of Korea - the triangular rice ball? that you eat on the train or bus, sam kak kim bab lol We also got the potato croquettes - oh my gosh sooo goooood. I love potatoes and these croquettes were plump, hot, and oh so potatoey! For the noodle selection, I got the tonkatsu miso ramen and the boofran got tonkatsu shoyu ramen. They were both good but I think I prefer the flavor and broth at Jinya better. I would definitely come back again though, the appetizers are hella good. They also have don bowls or whatever that I would like to try next time.
This place is Japanese food interpreted by Koreans I think. Not quite the same as ramen places in China town done by Japanese. Cool atmosphere but the food is lacking in something.

Only downside is they don't speak Japanese. But the food here is amazing and very ethentic. I ordered a crabmix onigiri. It came out hot. It was good, but I do perfer my onigiri at room temperature or slightly chilled like you can get in Japan. The Karage was delicious. Almost like KFC only high quality. The tempura was nice and lightly battered as well.

For a main entree I got the spicy Tonkatsu Ramen. Yum! I'm going to say its on par with Monta. The chirashi was thicker then normal though. But still soft.

 My husband got Tonkutsu Curry.  It was delicious, although I wish there was a spicy option for it. 

Will be back!!

I didn't listen when people said the soup was bland, and now I learned my lesson... The soup is indeed  bland.. As well as their fried rice. And their little salad was dressed with soy sauce. Karaage was the only thing edible but in an incredibly tiny portion for the price. It was a four course disappointment lol. But hey the service was great. And the jelly sake was delicious, even though it was $8 for a can smaller than a can of soda. And the interior of the restaurant was gorgeous. 

Would I return? NnnoooOOooo

I've come here only once, the outside looks cute, the inside looks super cute but the service sucks. We were seated all the way in the corner, we had to wait a really long time just to order and then another really really long time for my food. I wanted to order shrimp tempura for my noodles but it came so freaking late my noodles were already finished. Oh btw the broth isnt that good I got the kake udon and there weren't enough noodles and my friend ordered udon as well but he orders extra noodles with it. Let me tell you this, my friend finished his whole bowl of noodles and the soup even got cold before they brought out his extra noodles. I don't understand why they didn't just put it in the bowl and serve it all at once? Well anyways basically service was really bad and really slow and they kept forgetting our order, plus the food was mediocre. I tried to order Mochi and they were literally out of every flavor except like 3 flavors. I feel like The owner spent too much money on how the place will look but not enough time on the product. Sorry but I probably won't be coming back ): oh! And to add the soups are really expensive for such a small portion it's not even worth it. It's like $9-$10 a bowl when you can get cheaper and more in your bowl elsewhere

Not bad place to eat if you are hungry for some ramen or a bowl of beef with rice. The place offers wide variety of dish including CA style Poke bowl. The place is pretty trendy and service is excellent! Plus they are open late night!

I've been meaning to try this places since it opened. 

I must say that I'm a little disappointed......:( I mean who wouldn't want a great ramen place less then 5 minutes from your house? So.... When I went I was excited but disappointed with my first bite. :(

I got their hot green tea. It was pretty decent. But then again how can u mess up green tea?? OK traditional matcha tea is a whole different story...... Lol (4/5)

I got their onigiri as an app... It looked pretty... But the flavor was non existent. The daikon was salty salty salty...(2/5) but it helped the onigiri that was bland bland bland....:/ together they were OK... But the crab mix just had no flavor and the rice was overcooked so that it was on the mushy side and I'm sorry but who wants mushy rice in their onigiri?? (2/5)

I also got their tonkatsu shoyu.... And I know that shoyu is a Japanese soy sauce.... But still there should have been more balance in flavor. It was just salty salty salty. I'm seeing a trend here. Too much salt and not enough other flavors. It was not balanced at all. Did I eat it? Yes I did.... I was starving. :/ but did I enjoy it... Sadly no....:( 

Service was ok seeing as how I was the only person there. :) but I still had to ask her for a refill on my tea (4/5)

Ambiance.... It was cute. Same layout as when it was Rice Traxx but better decorations! :) (5/5)

Will I return... Most likely no... I would rather drive to Jinya or to other ramen places in the Chinatown area.
I'm not much of a ramen eater but this ramen was pretty good to me. I've tried other ramen places around the city but this one is one of my favs

Last time I was here was about 1.5-2 years ago. Ordered ramen but was not impressed with it (if you scroll down through the comments you'll see similar reviews from when they first opened). 

Was very craving ramen tonight and this was the only place open after 11 pm in the area. I Gave it another shot. Wow, what an improvement! I don't know if they changed chef or something, it was really good. 

Ramen was al dente, egg was perfect, compliments all flavorful. The soup is definitely lighter than Monta's and less salty. Which I don't think is a bad thing at all. Just different styles. 

Think this will be my new midnight spot after work. I'll try a few more things and update my review.

I know that they got hit hard with some low star reviews from the beginning. Giving five stars to help bring their average up.

Our favorite noodle place especially during cold season. Their tonkatsu is superb and the build your own poke bowl is delish! Come during the happy hour 7pm till close buy 1 get 1 free draft beer or house sake.

Great ramen place away from China Town. Very cute, trendy place. We were grated and seated right away. Ramen was great, not too salty, which is the best part. Same as the Chasu don, a bit sweet. We'll be back.

So there's this story about Lexus that goes something like this:

A few months after its launch, Lexus faced a potentially disastrous recall.  What could have been a major faux up actually helped to define a level of customer service people now closely associate with the luxury car company.

Our first visit to Omoide was kinda like that.
Although it was laden with way too many silly mistakes for a super slow lunch (food delivered to wrong table, missing orders, etc.), their level of attentiveness and speed in fixing our orders thereafter saved them from a far far worse review . . . the food also helped out a little.

I had the spicy tonkotsu with extra chasu: good broth, decent amount of heat, okay noodles, and good chasu.

The wife had the veggie miso with extra corn: tasty veggie broth and a good amount of greens and things.

Now I'm not saying Omoide is anyway like the Lexus of ramen.  All I am hoping for is that the ramen stays tasty and that next time we go things will go more smoothly.

If you are interested in getting the steak don bowl, do not bother. It is dry and flavorless steak. You can spend $12 on better food elsewhere.  The service was okay. We got one refill of water while we were there. My significant other got a chicken bowl dish. They were friendly but not super attentive once you got your order. Maybe I wouldn't have been do disappointed if I just got the ramen but a heads up for people who think it would have been a good  alternative.

I should've listened to me fellow Yelpers! But  the place look so cool I had to give it a try!   

Well the star of the show the "Ramen" was a let down. It tasted funny and wasn't impressive. Noodles were ehh, soup was ehh and toppings were even a bigger Ehh! All in all don't come here for the Ramen it was just Ehh. 

On the other hand my wife and I thought that the chicken Karaang and the Goyoza was delicious! The chicken was crispy and juicy and with the dipping sauce it was sweet and yummy. The goyoza was very flavorful and tasted really fresh, I can eat a hundred of them little sucker. Seared to a perfect crispiness on the outside and cooked with a great meaty inside. 

Let's just say I happy that this place is cool and it's in the neighborhood but I will not be running back here especially for the prices.
The Buta Shio is great - the udon noodles are so springy and fresh. The gyoza are also fantastic, they do have a little bit of spicy to them.

I like this place because it is affordable. However, I would not order the cold soba noodles because they weren't "satisfying." I probably will stick to the ramens or rice bowls. I guess I like more savory food. My friends liked what they ordered, which were ramens. We had ordered sides as well: chicken karaage, takoyaki, and a small rice bowl. Those were super good.

Update:
Second time around...much better! Seated quickly, food came out fast and service was great!

I tried their udon instead of the ramen (which I had last time) and I prefer the udon. The broth is better and the noodles aren't the thick udon noodles I've had at sushi and other Japanese restaurants. I like that you can add extras like wakame and fishcake (or tempura among other things).

I'm also a fan of the umeboshi nigiri, which if you're from Hawaii is basically a musubi with ume in it. I don't see this on a lot of menus and although it's a very simple item, I love it! Probably because it reminds me of home.

I'm glad I gave this place another chance. It was worth it!

Pretty decent place for ramen, close to my house so it is convenient. Very cute place, nice and clean. Been here twice now and they changed their menu, added more appetizers. Service was not the best, they only had about 2 tables but we still waited for refill, server did not check on us. 

They have a variety of ramen, fried rice, and appetizers. Got the spicy miso ramen and it was pretty good. Although the picture on the menu makes it look like you get 1 whole egg but you only get half... I love egg so I was sad when I only got half. Also takoyaki only comes in 4, other places usually come in 6 I believe. Tried their chasu buns which was weird, we expected slices of chasu but we got ground meat...nothing crazy flavorful. Also tried the kimchi pork belly bun which was ok.

Simple place with familiar menu options! Most of the time you'll find that the main ramen places are packed with a long wait list, but if you want to avoid crowds you can come here. It's your average Japanese ramen spot with several other menu options including katsu and bento type entrees. The food over here is decent I have no complaints. It's simple, but don't expect the best tasting broth or quality. It's not bad tasting, but it's not the greatest. Their pricing is around the same as other places near by, so you'll look to spend around $8-$13 per entree. I only tried their katsu and ramen here. I actually thought the katsu was pretty good! The staff is friendly and they provided good service based on my experience. Give it a try if you're looking for somewhere new to eat

The family and I decided to try some Japanese noodles nearby so we picked out this place.
The place is very clean and decorative with Japanese decors. 
I picked the tonkatsu miso ramen and it was mediocre due to the salty broth.
Overall this place has great customer service but the saltiness of the food will keep me away for some time.

Great for those ramen cravings when you just don't want to drive the distance to spring mountain.  The broth is tasty, and chashu delicious. My only complaint is that the ramen bowls don't come with egg. You'll have to pay an extra $1.50 for an egg. On the otherhand the bowls are reasonably priced.

There is also a great selection of appetizers and dons (rice bowls) if you're not feeling ramen.

Ordered the kitsune soba noodles with a side of potato croquette; the croquette was just right; not too hard and tasted just as I imagined. My soup broth was delicious, tofu was good and light, and the service was excellent. My other 2 friends also agreed that their meal was delicious. By the way, did I mention that the decor is wonderful! They also play only Japanese songs, which is perfectly fine with me. 
I recommend giving this place a shot if you're in the area or in the mood for some noodles.

I have only been here 5x and always have the lunch special, so that's what my review is based on. I love it! It's tons of food for the price and includes a drink. I love the decor, the service is friendly, and they seem to have a great menu. I look forward to trying more on the dinner menu. UPDATE: Omoide has quickly become my weekly lunch date spot with my husband. We just love it here! My favorite dishes are the poke bowls, tonkotsu shoyu ramen, and chashu don. The udon is also great!

The Goods
1. I liked the ramen and the pork katsu, usually these catch all Asian places do everything adequately, but I thought the food was pretty good!
2. I'd go back to try the soba and udon
3. Also offers sushi
4. I'd say it's good for groups so that there is something for everyone or if you cannot decide between noodles curry or sushi 

Service
1. Good, they did refill iced tea which was yum 
2. Good parking 
3. CC ok and cash 

Ambiance
1. Clean and somewhat romantic with dim lighting 

MoJo
1. The strength is in the variety but I believe better than expected.  Cannot wait to try some sushi

Located in an awkward area of the shopping center. Pay attention to where you park, you might park in the back thinking that's the front. 

I got off work super late and I wanted food. Saw that they have happy hour, Buy one get one free on beer/sake. I was like, why not? I had a long day at work.

Ordered the grilled squid and chicken karaage don. Ok, the squid was alright, grilled and no seasoning to it. The chicken karaage was a little off. Especially the breading. I guess that's their take on it. 

But other than that, service was good and would come back for another HH drink.

Super happy to have a ramen house next to my house!!!!! Driving to spring mountain wasn't always so fun. The decor upon entering was eye pleasing. Traditional in a more modern tone. Cute!

The service honestly "on point" comes to mind. The minute we entered to the second we left our server was super attentive and extremely friendly. She suggested some great appetizers along with an entree that hit spot. We tried the karaage and shishito peppers as an app, then I had the spicy ramen. All delicious!!  The ramen was pretty spicy but I LOVE spicy!! So it was perfect.

I'll be back especially when winter arrives!!!

In Vegas Ramen scene Omoide Noodles & Bowls falls short of the competition. I just feel the Ramen is ok at best nothing spectacular, jaw dropping, and memorable. I ordered the Tonkatsu Ramen with my lunch special. The broth for me just lacked flavor or any kind or depth. My normal go to spots the Tonkatsu Ramen feel more heavier broth unlike one here is water down and lacked any kind of depth or distinct flavor. The toppings get nice amount like any other Ramen spot in Vegas. Ramen it starts and ends with the broth. Unfortunately did not work for me. Next time I will try order Shoyu broth. The Curry Bowl that was five star experience!! It Japanese style brown curry. Right off the back my favorite style curry. It delivered on point! I just wished ordered bigger bowl. =( I love the fact even for side dish for the lunch special not skimpy came to the portion size. The curry has nice amount of chicken and vegetables in it. The house salad that came with the lunch special was good. I enjoyed the vinaigrette style dressing on it. LUNCH special talk about steal of deal. $12 there no way can go wrong in life. Bowl of noodles, choice side, and drink plus house salad. I know plan on coming back again just for the lunch special and more curry bowl action.

The decor is pretty cool. Thinking for small restaurant off the strip in tiny strip shopping mall Omoide had tons tons of personality. Right from the moment you walk in with the Ramen Bar set up if by yourself great spot get your noodles on. The cool lights and the Japanese advertisement with everything in Japanese. Definitely nothing like you would think from the outside. The service was five star they were awesome explaining everything being first timer and going over the lunch special cause talk about options. Not just lunch specials the regular menu has nice diversity.

Been here twice for lunch, and I just gotta say their lunch special deal is a STEAL! $12 for noodles, rice, and a drink!

On my first visit, I had the lunch special with tonkotsu shoyu ramen, curry bowl, and an iced green tea. The ramen was quite yummy: the noodles were cooked perfectly - not too soggy yet not too hard; the chashu had a lot of flavor; and I had a nice helping of green onions to go with it. I'm not really a fan of the big piece of seaweed in my ramen, so I didn't really care for it. The curry don was your normal japanese curry with rice; nothing too special. Finally, the iced green tea. Let's just say it was so watered down it seems like I was drinking green-colored water. At least it was free with the lunch special. Lol.

My second visit I had the shrimp tempura udon, the chashu don, and a hot green tea. Warning: don't expect to get the thick udon noodles you're used to. Think the  thinner dry instant udon noodles you can buy at the supermarket. Also, they literally dunk your shrimp tempura in the broth, so by the time it gets to the table, there is no crisp to the tempura anymore; just soggy tempura wrapped shrimp. I didn't really care for the udon. Next was the chashu don. The sauce of the chashu gets soaked into the rice and it just makes it SO much better. Let's just say the chashu don more than made up for the disappointing udon. I practically licked the bowl clean and wanted seconds! As for the hot green tea, let's just say I was letting it cool before drinking it. About 10 minutes later, the waitress came and switched it for a new steaming hot green tea! I was like, "Uh... I was waiting for it to cool before drinking it."... I guess +1 for above and beyond customer service? LOL!

I'll definitely be returning again just for the chashu don. :)
Great atmosphere. Amazing selection of food. I had the curry noodles and the katsu bun. Everything was great. Coming back again.

So much goodness here that I am going to have to come back to be able to take it all in. 

I really like the design inside. I feel like I'm in an old Japanese village restaurant but it still keeps a modern feel to it. Very cool. 

Then there's the awesome variety of menu items. There is a lunch special too but I'm here for an early dinner. They have a couple of Katsu items. Tonkatsu. Bowls. Noodles. All the favorites. And the price is totally reasonable. 

How is this not the hottest place this side of the Pacific Ocean?? 

I guess it's tucked away and kept a little secret but not for long. It's too good not to try.

Only the second place I found that served Katsu-don.  It came hot like I like it but there was no shiro (sauce) in the bottom for the rice so by the time I got under the pork cutlet it was very dry, hot, but very dry.  Very difficult grinding the rest of my order so I have to give only two stars.  Service was very good though.  Best Katsudon I've ever had was in 1968 in Vietnam during jungle down time.  Ate at this fabulous house owned by Thai's had a restaurant inside and catered to every body.  Can't beat there food next to Hwuang's, monkey brain, tiger soup, snake teriyake, etc.

I'm not sure why this place has such a crazy hype, the food is not at all authentic and service is mediocre at best. 

Ordered:
Spicy tonkatsu- "water with hot sauce"
Kimchi bun - bland 
Chashu bun - very dry 
Gyoza

We barely touched our food.
Great place for a quick ramen fix. Good atmosphere, delightful. There's one waitress that always remembers us and they have great service.

Chilly night so decided to get some ramen here. Ordered just shoyu ramen and potato croquette which was good. For vegas locals, this is the old Rice Trax location. Atmosphere was okay, service was okay but they have to change the music. They had some sort of rave music going, not quite matched to the atmosphere. I would probably dine there again.
Absolutely great. For my first time the food was amazing and the staff was incredible. I'll definitely be going back.
I really liked this place.  The ramen was good and it's close to my place.  Haven't had a bad ramen place though.

It only took me one trip to this place to convince me I won't be back. I'm giving it 3 stars mainly because the place is really cozy and clean. And I'm sure maybe some of the other menu items could be better than what we ordered...
So my broth was bland in flavor and the meat was really tough and undercooked.
The server knew nothing of the menu and could only say what she liked and what was popular. I'd ask questions like how is the meat prepared, do u have spicy dishes you could recommend, basic menu questions that she should've known the answer to. I mean it was my first time there and was not familiar with their menu.
I'd like to say I'd give it another chance but I'd rather try other places since there's SO MANY restaurants to choose from.
Cute place though!

I was glad to hear a new ramen/udon/soba/rice bowl place had opened in the Southwest part of Vegas. I ordered the chicken karaage and shrimp udon. I had one of my friend's gyoza and sampled the Spicy Tonkotsu Shoyu ramen. 

Chicken Karaage was decent but I would have liked more seasoning. I hate to say this but I was really disappointed in my udon. The broth was too light & thin and had a weird, indescribable taste to it. I couldn't figure out what was in it or what was missing. I didn't care for the udon consistency either. I prefer the noodles to be chewy, soft, and thick. Sadly, I've had better $1 udon from the market. My husband said his ramen was just OK.

The service was good and the food came out in a reasonable manner. I didn't finish my udon and thought of driving to a fast-food joint after but decided to eat dessert at home instead. I'm not sure if I would return to try the other items. I'll read the reviews and see how things pan out.

The best katsu in southwest Las Vegas between 10 - 11pm!!!

We stopped in to Omioide and went with the waitress's recommendations, Tonkatsu Ramen, Katsu Don, Konbu Onigiri, and Pumkin Croquette. Aside from the raw egg white on the Katsu Don everything was palatable...then again most places aren't going merely for palatable food options. We didn't hate any items we tried...but we would certainly rather venture elsewhere. The ramen lacked flavor, and I literally thought on first bite, "Well, this is edible." My favorite item was the Pumkin Croquette, but even here; this isn't something I could ever envision myself specifically wanting to stop in to Omioide to get. All around they are a strong two star or very weak three stars. The problem is that with the exception of ramen most of their menu can be found nearby at a similar price point with much better versions. ...and for ramen I'd rather make the trip to Flamingo or Spring Mountain than come back. It sounds a little harsh, but the food certainly wasn't A-OK...it was precisely, "Meh. I've experienced better."

It's hard to recommend an item that was served with unintended raw egg, but if you find your way here, I think I would go with the Katsu Don to go with the aforementioned Pumkin Croquette. Omioide took over the old Rice Trax building and fans of that quality & originality of food may enjoy themselves here. 

The interior is more than adequate for this price range and we actually really like the padded double-chair/loveseat-chairs. They were comfortable and certainly something you don't typically find. While we didn't particularly relish anything, Omioide seems like the kind of place that will do okay in this part of town with teenagers, twenty-something's, and individuals that don't seek out great food.
I give 4 stars.  Service is great,  cute and spacious decor.  Some dishes need more improvement overall, i would go back again.

I went here a few days ago and tried there spicy ramen since that's what I usually always get when I go for ramen. After taking my first sip I noticed that their miso is watered down, there are many other places I've gone too that I feel are way more creamier, I even added butter and corn and usually when I do that it just becomes creamer at other ramen spots. Also, the noodles weren't my favorite. I felt like this place wasn't as authentic than other ones I've been to. all in all it wasn't bad but being that I've been to other places that I feel are better in my opinion made me compare. But on the plus side the service here was great, everyone was real nice and explained everything well.

Another favorable experience.  I had asked for extra Chasu (pork) and eggs for my bowl....they did not disappoint.  Started things off with gyoza...very nice.   Service was very good.  And the décor was very serene.

I'm glad I gave this spot a second chance. This time I ordered the cold udon noodles and it was amazing. I think my waitress had a lot to do with why I left a 3 star review last time. This time around my waiter was very attentive and more knowledgeable of the menu than my waitress on my first visit here. I will be back!

Kids choice night. They wanted Ramen. I suggested this place because according to their yelp, they serve Ramen. After our experience here, I think I've created little foodie monster children lol. They are so blunt and hey, kids keeps it real!

I had no influence in their opinions, yet I always encourage kindness. But my unfiltered 6 year old son and 3 year old daughter had the most funniest facial reactions to their "ramen". 

"Mommy, the noodles are so hard."
"Eww what kind of soup is this?" (Miso and shoyu base)
"Mommy, you tricked us, you said they'd have Ramen." 
"Can we never come back here again?"

I had to keep shushing them because other customers were looking our way. My husband tried their Ramen and agreed. My 11 year old son, however, enjoyed his grilled chicken wings. The other two little kiddos asked if they can have potstickers because they couldn't eat anymore soup. After encouraging them to eat more, I did order some potstickers, and my hungry little monsters gobbled up the two orders.

I enjoyed my salmon sashimi and plain rice onigiri. In fact, I had hubby pick some up for me to-go another night since the kids were so adamant about not wanting to eat here ever again lol.

3 stars for the good service we had, the grilled wings, potstickers, and salmon sashimi. Not a great choice for Ramen.
Bun was not soft like how they should be. Chicken curry was great and the ramen was delish. Prices are AWESOME!!! Cool vibe inside too. Great service.

I've been to this restaurant 3 times now. First was when they just opened. I liked the decor and menu selection. We ordered 2 different ramen and zaru soba. All noodles tasted not fully cooked and broth wasn't impressive. Service was pretty good but overall, we were disappointed.
Because the place is so close to my house, we wanted to like the place and gave another try. Second time we went, it was packed but had only one server. Service was friendly but slow. At least noodles tasted better.
Then finally the third time we went, the restaurant now seemed all in place and settled. Service was prompt, very friendly and attentive, and noodles were perfect texture. We ordered tonkotsu, spicy tonkotsu miso, ten zaru, gyoza and pumpkin croquette (i tried potato croquette before but pumpkin croquette was more flavorful) and all tasted very good. I was satisfied with food and service. So glad they have improved since they first opened and now met our expectations! I'm definitely going back!

Not the richest best tasting ramen I've had, but I did quite enjoy it! I ordered the lunch special with pork ramen and pork chashu bowl. I ordered them plain and was quite happy with it. The noodles had a nice chew, the soup was a think milky consistency. The pork bowl had a savery  sweet flavor and quite a bit of pork. We also ordered the chicken, which was very flavorful and tasty. 

I suggest trying this place.

Cute exterior menu board and interior decor, so I really wanted to like this place! It's trying to be what people expect Tokyo to be like, but just an FYI, it's not actually...which would totally be ok if the authenticity in flavors was there... The menu had good options, but I'm afraid our lunch didn't live up to my expectations. The karaage wasn't seasoned enough - there needs to be more salt and maybe a crispier batter (higher cooking temp fryer so it's crispy on the outside and juicy on the inside), and if we're trying to avoid over salting, there should be condiments on the side (salt and pepper) on the table, but there wasn't...or at least offered on the side (there was curry powder and a mayo/soy sauce on the side instead...maybe chili pepper could've been an option?). The onigiri fell short also, the rice was overcooked (wet), and the ume filling was ok - but for the price I wouldn't typically point this out as a fault except that the rest of the meal wasn't that tasty either. Then my miso ramen - it wasn't hot (maybe the bowls should be warmed prior to serving? Because it was room temp when it got to the table), the ramen noodle was different, and slightly overcooked. The miso base itself was rather bland and more orange in color than I typically have, so maybe it was a different miso base?  Overall everything was ok, and the best way to explain it is that all the flavors are mild. Other notes - it bothered me that multiple tables brought on outside drinks, and no one said anything (as in, 1 table had Starbucks, another had raising canes, but maybe it's just that casual?)...and when our apps came out, there were no utensils/napkins/plates? We had to wait for each of our entrees to come out for them to bring each setting (since mine came out first, I had chopsticks, but my companion had to wait for their ramen to eat the app!). Finally, no one stopped by to touch our table (server or manager) to see how we were doing until I was waiting for a check and the server saw how my ramen was not touched much, as I just didn't care for it any more than an instant ramen I can make at home. If you're in the area and want a quick bite/fast food, this may definitely be the place for you! But I think you're might be better off going to Chinatown for a better meal at the same price, and if you like stronger flavors/temperature-appropriate meals.
Waited 30 minutes for them to give me a BS excuse of my order being lost and having to reorder. If you like waiting and not eating come here. Worst Ramen place ever!

I love this ramen place before but when they recently upgraded their menu and renovated their place everything change. Prices went up, portions/quantity decreased. Quality hmmmm about the same but not quite as before. I graded it 1 as i keep on coming here just to give them them benefit of a doubt but today i totally had it. Service wasnt that great. If only they made everything for the better but the changes just made everything worse. This would be the last time as i found a new place. In durango and warm spring place of the ramen plae starts with an O!

The good: perfectly cooked egg, tasty pork broth, chasu.

The bad: imperfect rice texture/flavor. No liquor license but won't allow byob/w.  Below average tempura.  The Japanese typos on the menu (our Japanese friends were laughing and cringing at the same time) obviously not designed by a native speaker of Japanese. 

So much promise but missing conviction and follow through.

Came here for a late Sunday lunch with my husband. The staff is really friendly and fast. My husband got udon noodles (buta shio bukkake) and I ordered their tempura bowl (ten don). The tempura was great, the shrimp wasn't thin like most places. The pork belly in the buta shio bukkake was super tender & perfect. Overall the food & service was great! It was my first time there and my husbands second. Highly recommend trying their rice balls (onigiri). We'll be going to Omoide again since my kids and husband love noodles.

This place is slowly becoming my favorite ramen place. They have a great vegetable miso which is great when you want to avoid meat. It's not as far away as china town so that's nice when you don't live close to that side of town. Good atmosphere and good service. It's a very reliable spot. Check it out!

Omoide is a really great place, and the decorations are so cute! The staff are super sweet, and the food is equally just as great. I'd say that thier Ramen is one of my favorites, and we always come to this place a little after 3:00. There's no wait at all, which is pretty important to consider especially when a place like this serves some popular food.

Not bad for a little Japanese restaurant.  It has all the comfort food that we crave. Good udon soup, delicious katsu don, all mind of ramen.  My 5 year old daughter finished an entire bowl of udon soup by herself.

We had the udon and my 5 year old cleared the bowl. Everything was authentic and it was served just as we asked for it. I had the curry udon and it was good as well.  The udon noodles were thawed and served but it was still tasty and hit the spot. The katsu curry was just as good as you will find in Japan. The spice was perfect for me but maybe a bit much for my 3yo. I'll definitely be back to try the ramen.

So a friend of mine put me on to ramen noodles recently and I've been hooked ever since. I've been to some amazing ramen noodle places around town and Omoide is right up there with the best. What makes this place extra special is the total package. Great location, love the decor, amazing service and finally delicious noodles.
Place is delicious. It's like a salad with all the toppings. Price is reasonable. Pretty quick in ordering and bringing out the food .

This place is too cute! Love the atmosphere. There's always something unique to look at. Good place to eat when your hungover too, lol. Food is very flavorful and I loveeeee loveee loveee their ramen. I'll definitely be coming back here and recommending to friends. Haven't had good ramen like this since I moved from California. Customer service was on top of it. :)

Service was great, but didn't enjoy my tonkotsu miso soup at all. We also ordered the shrimp tempura and that too didn't taste like any shrimp tempura we've had. 

I would highly recommend going to jenya or Sapporo instead for great ramen.
I absolutely love this place. I didn't know what half the items on the menu were, but our server took the time to explain them without hesitation. The food is amazing and I love the fun decor.

Came in here the other night craving soup. Had not heard or read anything about the place before coming (which is rare for me considering I am an avid yelper). The atmosphere and decor was very cool, made to look like you're in Japan. Restaurants these days are becoming very creative I must say. I ordered the Spicy tonkatsu and the boyfriend ordered the pork katsu bowl. Overall, I'd say the ramen was medicore,  no where near as full bodied and flavorful as Monta Ramen. The Katsu was fairly good, and came with miso soup and salad. Service was good as well. Wasn't wowed by this place but  not bad.

Food was delicious. I ordered a Katsu curry & wanted to add a side of corn. Technically you're not suppose to do that because the owner is very traditional Japanese and doesn't like to mess with how the food it actually suppose to taste but since my boyfriend ordered ramen the server just added the side of corn to his order. I liked the fact that it's a both ramen & also rice bowl kind of place. On top of that it's on the SW side of town. So much more convenient than driving across town. Our server was very attentive & the restaurant look very traditional & clean. I also found out through our server that omoide means dreams / memories. I like that!
Great deal for lunch! Big bowl of Ramen, salad, rice and Pork belly....and a soda for $12

Why does this place only have 3 and a half stars?? The food is really flavorful, the service is awesome and fast, happy hour 9-1 am, buy 1 get 1 free sake or beer! Maybe it doesn't have 5 stars because people don't want it to get busy lol. Cause I almost did that myself
Love coming to this place, came here on Christmas and it's still great! Our waitress was the best! Food was spot on. Couldn't ask for more
Great place to eat lunch and dinner.  The service is always good along with the food!  I ate here today and it's near my house.  Love the noodles and appetizers!

This is a nice little local spot. Casual atmosphere, music at a good level, and attentive service. We started with Pumpkin Croquettes and Tako Yaki appetizers. Tako Yaki is a ball of fried octopus, and it was perfectly cooked and drizzled with a tasty sauce. The pumpkin croquettes were different, but no complaints at the table. It was sweet and savory, and fried so how could you go wrong? 
The Udon Shrimp Tempura was served boiling hot, with two large pieces of tempura shrimp. Could have used a larger portion of Udon noodles, but the flavor was on point. A friend had the Katsu Don, a large portion of breaded chicken over rice, served with salad, pickled veggies and miso soup. The plate was empty so I assume he enjoyed it!
Finally we tried the Honey Toast, (I try honey toast every time I see it on a menu.) It was good. That's all I can say. Not spectacular, not bad at all. The side of black sesame ice cream tasted like it had spent too long in the freezer, probably not popular enough to sell through regularly. 
I'd try it again if I was going to eat with a friend or group, and was looking for a quick, hot lunch.

Awsome experience! 

Service - friendly and fast. They even offer these very cute chopstick training accessories (ask for one!)
  
Food - delicious! I will definitely be coming back for more! 

Cleanliness - you can see they take pride in their service. The ambiance is truly one to see!

This place is exactly what we needed on this side of town. I can see why the harsh reviews, it isn't the usual tiny, overcrowded, divy place that cool douchy hipsters would prefer. Instead it's roomy, properly decorated, staff is very nice and the food is solid. Can't go wrong with the ramen here. Very good, and the waitress took her time to go over the menu and explain it to us. That to me goes a very long way. According to some of the reviews, they must've had a bumpy start when they first opened ("waited this long for my menu", or "this long for my food" god forbid that happens on a grand opening! Pfft) but they are on point right now. I'll be back again for sure.

Alright ever since they revamped their interior and introduced a new menu with a variety of different items, this place is quickly becoming my go-to restaurant in the southwest area, period. I absolutely LOVE what they did to improve the restaurant, bravo! Seriously guys.

To start, the interior has been revamped to give it a more intimate vibe. The booths on the left side of the restaurant has a Japanese style canopy. It's a nice touch.

My favorite part by far is the introduction of new items on their menu. This place has some of the BEST tonkatsu money can buy. I am borderline addicted to their King Tonkatsu, which is a fat-ass piece of tonkatsu served on a massive plate. 

The reason why I love this tonkatsu is they flatten this thing to hell so it's extremely wide and thin. When served the pork is so thin it almost melts in your mouth. I love how thin the texture is. I'm usually not a fan of pork in general but it honestly tastes like beef briskets because of the thinness of it. The homemade sauce they serve with it is to die for. I love the balance of sweet and sour it has.

Last but not least they have a wicked buy one get one free beer or sake during the nighttime. This place never had a drinking vibe to it but I think the new interior makes it a fun place to have a few drinks at. I haven't tried their newer noodle bowls and I'm excited to try what they have to offer!

Food is awesome, service is great!  I don't need to drive far to get great Japanese food this place will be my 2nd Kitchen. Also happy hour 20% off I can't asked for anything more.  Try it you'll love it!!!

The aesthetics of the place is really eye catching. The service was half decent. The waitress only brighten up until we ordered two of their special beers with peach and lychee flavor. Which were good. 

The food though is a whole other story. The noodles were done right. Their soup doesn't have that umami flavor.. It's missing quite a lot. I wouldn't come here for their noodles. 

IMO, their Chasu don bowl is probably the only I would come there for. The rice was just right paired with the sauce of the Chasu and pickled plum and radishes. Their rice bowls come with salad and miso soup. Their salad were sprinkled with a dash of yuzu to give it a citrus-y flavor. 

The black sesame ice cream was just what was needed to make the meal feel complete. But overall,  I left feeling full but unsatisfied, the noodles lacked a lot of flavor and umami.
This place looks very Japanese, I felt like I am in Tokyo with them playing Japanese music. Food is ok, I came here for Ramen and who knew Udon has more noodle than Ramen.
Not only is this place close to our house but the place is so good. ramen is Delish, I always get the spicy miso and my kids love the bowls.

Yes! Another GOOD Japanese restaurant in Las Vegas. I've been here twice now and I've ordered two different dishes: the cold noodles and the Karaagedon Set. No words, just  and 'Mmm!'s. 

Cute atmosphere. Service is meh. The only catch to this place is that you have to be buff enough to eat here.. The door at the front is ridiculously heavy.

First time here, but not a first timer in eating ramen. I order the spicy tonkatsu ramen and veggie tempura. I'm very impress by the flavor and spicyness of the soup. The tempura batter was light and crisp. The decor is a industrial japanese vibe, which something new and cool. I'm definitely coming back to try more of the menu!

This ramen restaurant is located conveniently 2 blocks away from where I live. I went there out of curiosity and hunger and ordered the spicy tonkotsu shoyu ramen. It really blew me away how delicious it was. The broth had just the right amount of spice and the toppings were all amazing. The portion was enough for me to be full, but not uncomfortably stuffed. The staff is polite and the place was super clean. It's no monta, but it is still incredibly good.
Awesome service from music. fair pricing. I had the takoyaki, katsu bun, chashu bun, menchi katsu, and chicken karaage . They were all amazing. I will definitely be coming here again.

Service was excellent and the lunch special combinations are good portioned! I'm a huge ramen enthusiast so this place was good for something close by but probably wouldn't come when i super yummy ramen. Was at Fidget Indoor Playground and wanted something soupy to clear my sinuses.

It's hard to find a great Ramen place that also serves great soba and udon. I'm so glad we found the right place! This restaurant is lovely, with a succinct menu featuring a handful of apps, noodle combos, and bowls. They serve Ramune soda, which is a plus. We started with the typical apps - tempura and karagge.
