Both were very good. My cold soba with tempura was fantastic. You can't go wrong with soba on a hot day. 

You'll probably bump into me at a corner table on the regular. I'll be the one with 4 orders of tempura apps and soba noodles.

I had the shrimp tempura curry bowl and my friend had ramen. My meal came with some Miso soup and salad as well. My curry had some spice and kick to it which I liked. It was a spice level of about 1 of 10. Shrimp tempura was fried perfectly as sometimes people tend to cook it too long and the 3 shrimp were placed in a big bowl of rice and curry. One thing I wished this place had was some alcoholic beverages. Decor was cool. You can see all the paper lanterns hanging from the ceiling as well.

I love the inside of this establishment. It's very spacious and you don't have to worry about being too close to the other patrons. The decoration for Omoide definitely tops all the ramen places I've been to.

As far as food is concerned, this place isn't my go-to for ramen. Something about their base for the tonkotsu ramen is off to me. Out of all the ramen places I visit, their tonkotsu is my least favorite. The texture on the noodles aren't up to par with the other place I frequent either. I've also tried their takoyaki and it's alright to me. 

Service here though is very good. You are always waited on very quickly, whether it be to ask how the food is or if drinks need to be refilled, they're on top of it. While this place isn't my favorite, some of my friends love this place and I can understand why.

First of all, I am really excited that there is finally a ramen place here in the Southwest! So when we saw that this place opened, we tried it right away. 

I learned that "omoide" means "memories, recollections" in Japanese which is reflected well within the interior of this ramen place. The design reminds me of a street in Japan where you find a random ramen spot and discover that it's a diamond in the rough. It is very well-lit (love the paper lanterns!) and spacious. I like that the windows are big letting more light into the place. Most ramen places make it so that their interiors are dark.  It makes me feel a little claustrophobic sometimes. The ambiance inside Omoide is homey and comforting. 

The food here is decent. Not the best. It is hard not to compare it to Monta Choya. Their broth for their ramen is pretty bland. I think that is a good thing. It is refreshing to have a ramen place where you can control how salty you want your broth to be.  The portions are big so you get your money's worth. 

Overall, this is still a pretty good ramen place. They are new so there is always room for improvement.

The restaurant has a cool decor/setup. Also, the waitress' are very friendly & helpful. I got the Shrimp Tempura Udon and a side of Mixed Veggie Tempura. My boyfriend got the Chicken Katsu Curry and a side of Cha Su Don. Everything was delicious! The food we got I believe is reasonably priced for the portion they serve. I will be returning again!

I like this place. The environment is very charming and it's nice to have a simple noodle and rice bowl place in the neighborhood. The highlights include the raw octopus wasabe dish and shabu shabu salad.
Reliably great food, attentive wait staff, nice setting. A real find in the West Vegas strip mall jungle...

HANDS DOWN ONE OF MY FAVORITE RAMEN SPOTS!!

This is my 6th time eating at this place and I've enjoyed every visit. The first impression I got from this place (when first entering in) is that it's super cute with its tiny random seat bar. The menu has plenty of food to choose from 
usually order the Tonkatsu Shoyu (my FAV) and every time I order it I fall in love. 
Most of the time I go and dine here the waitresses are such a delight. She always takes care of my boyfriend and I whenever we stop to eat. 
I will keep recommending friends and family to try out this lovely place. ^_^

Sashimi was fresh and worth the price! We had appetizers, dinner and dessert. If you like traditional Japanese food and ramen, this is a great place to get it! For all the Hawaii transplant yelpers, you'll like it here, very similar to Japanese food back home!

After all the times that I've been to the southwest side to find a place to eat or run errands, I've always told myself I'm going to try this place out. Now, I can finally check mark it off my list. :]

The restaurant itself is nicely decorated and I love how they stuck with the theme of an old town Japanese noodle vendor. It looks as though it has warped into a lil nook on the southwest side of town. The high ceiling makes the place look so open. And when you look up at all the hanging lights and decor, it makes you feel like you're stuck in a dream. Corny? Well, just trust me... and LOOK UP. ;]

The service was great and I have no complaints about the food or wait time. Their menu is really simple and they've broken it down to mini appetizers, ramen, hot/cold noodle dishes, poke bowls, and rice platters. I tried the Tonkatsu ramen and my friend had the Gyudon (See the menu on Yelp for pics and descriptions). Both were really good! The portions were just right for the price and the presentation of the meals were nothing fancy. We also ordered the Honey Bread for dessert and it was a nice lil treat to top off our meals.

Would I come back to this place? Yes, but only if I'll be in the area. There are a lot of equally great noodle/ramen houses as well as poke bowl restaurants all around Vegas, so they need to add just a little something extra to the menu to make me want to drive this far. But all in all, a nice lil stop for a simple meal. :]

I'd have to say 5 star food, 2 stars customer service sometimes. Old lady very grouchy needs a vacation! Love this place because the food is so great so we go there often, but before going always pray we don't get her as our waitress.  Other girls are ok but #1 for me is customer service! So sad they are low stars due that, not food.
Sooo yummy! Lots of great options to choose from! Love it, great location in the neighborhood and awesome service!

This was first time trying this place is thought it was good something different.  I  got some kind of curry dish which was pretty good I forgot the name of it but when I come back I'm get the same thing.  I loved the iced green tea they have.

This is my favorite restaurant by far in Las Vegas. I am a fairly picky eater and I love small plates (Tapas) because I enjoy variety when I go out. The problem is at most places their small plates are very expensive. Here they are not only affordable but delicious. My husband and I  got a small rice plate with tuna, gyoza, onigiri, a pork bun and the spicy tonkatsu ramen. All were top par. Amazing!

Wonderful service and great food
The hot noodles were delicious and the service was fast
The atmosphere was very nice and feels very comfortable as well
Very good place to eat, lots of different noodles selection . Sake and really good poke bowls is a must try . Very friendly staff and clean environment. A place I will be coming back too.

Omoide has a rustic Japanese feel with food that brings the spirit of the Far East to your table. The Chicken Karaage Don is savory and the serving more than enough to sate the hungriest of patrons. Just make sure to ask about what's not on the menu as there are many hidden delights.

I enjoy trying every place at least once and the reviews from this place definitely warranted a visit...that being said my wife and I were not thoroughly impressed with the food. Ok, not great.

We can check this place off the list, but in the end we won't be back.

I have to say that ever since I left Los Angeles many moons ago, I found myself having an occasional  Yoshinoya craving. I don't know what possessed me  to pull over and try this restaurant out ....ok, it was the cool looking building and a sign that said "Noodles", but I'm absolutely glad I did!

I went in there with miso ramen in mind. As I was looking over the menu, I came across this Gyu Don. The picture looked familiar, so I read the description . It said 'thinly sliced beef with onions in a sweet soy sauce over rice.' Say wuut!?!? Naturally, I ordered it and OMG!!! It hit home! It reminded me of the beef bowl from yoshinoya but way, way better!!! I was totally in heaven! Sprinkled some of that red pepper and it was bomb. 

For appetizer I had this chasu bun thing. Looked like a taco but with bread. Very tasty! 

I had to give it 4 stars because as much as I liked the gyudon, I can't justify paying 9 bucks for it. Maybe if they lowered the price to $7, I'd be down to go back and get more, but as of now, I got my fix and I'm good.

I went to Amoide with very low expectations and ended up they become our favorite Ramon restaurant in Vegas! We went there 3 times in 8 days! That's usually how often we eat Ramon in a year. Not only their Ramon, all the dishes we tried were amazing and they also have great service! Looking forward to going back!

I came here on opening day unknowingly and at the time, you could tell they just opened.

I walked in and it seemed really established. The furniture was new and they designed the restaurant well with Japanese themed decorations. The menu is fairly simple, but if you aren't familiar with Japanese dishes, then it could be a challenge. I knew most of the items on the menu, but it seemed to have some duplications so I asked about them. The waitress half answered my question with no confidence until she asked her manager and even with the manager's answer, I didn't buy it. I still don't know the difference between the katsu don and tonkatsu don. Then I just asked about a few more items and she had to continue going back and asking about them. I know she will learn in time, but I thought knowledge of items would be something that would be well covered before opening. As long as she learns, I don't mind.

The food was nothing spectacular, just up to par for Japanese food. Their onigiri was not that great at all. I got the beef and bonito onigiri and I wouldn't order them here again honestly unless a lot of time has passed. I ordered the chicken karaage bowl and it comes with a salad and soup. They forgot my soup and when I told them I was missing my soup, it didn't come out very hot, so that was a red flag for me. My mom ordered the spicy tonkatsu ramen and it wasn't spicy at all. The noodles and everything else in it was ok, but nothing spectacular.

I see major potential for this place and can help fulfill the missing Japanese food niche in Vegas. They had a lot of hiccups opening day, but things can turn around really easily.

Finally happy to find something nearby. Love the decoration and ambiance of this place. Similar to when you are in Japan. Tonkotsu Shoyu Ramen here is good and comes with egg and bamboo shoot already. Other places you have to add those seperately. 
L.A poke bowl and the Honey Bread is to die for. Servings are big. 5 star for this place. Keep it up!

Another good option for ramen in southwest Vegas.  It seemed as if Omoide gives you a very easy-going ramen experience.  The bowls seem bigger, more noodles, and tons of toppings.  Surprisingly big chunks of chasu which is nice as Vegas seems to be on the skinnier side when it comes to the meat.  The spicy broth actually delivered a good heat throughout the course, perhaps taking some of the Korean influence from the area with a gochujang-esque accompanied spicy sauce in the bowl.  My filling bowl came to $11 after tax.  In and out in less than 45 minutes. Omoide is a fine option for ramen in the Valley.  But don't overlook the huge menu with tons of rice and noodle options if you're not in the ramen mood.

I really wanted to give this place 5 stars because its near my place and I was excited to finally have a ramen spot within walking distance... however this is not the case.

I had the Chicken Kaarage and Tonkatsu Ramen Bowl. Both were nothing to rave about.  Kaarage was bland, and my ramen came out cold, and no flavor.

I know they just opened, but its hard to go back to somewhere that didnt blow me away.

Yes!!! A pretty good ramen shop on my side of town! I was very happy with their decor and environment! They had awesome lanterns hanging from their very high  ceilings and an outdoor ramen shop storefront style seating area at the front! The girls taking the orders and serving the food were really nice, happy and informative. Both my and I will be back again, very soon :D

I had always drove past this place so my friend and I decided to go try it. When I walked in it had great decor and ambiance it felt exotic. So I wasn't sure if I wanted a noddle dish but I ordered everything off the appetizer menu and I have to say the food is Amazing! The price is pretty decent and I did also order Udon noddles at the end but needless to say 5 stars  I recommend this place! I had food coma after but well worth it! 

Best, 

K.Kaviar
The place looks like little Japan! The lanterns on the ceiling will be the first thing you'd notice. The food is good and simple!  You can't go wrong when they have curry and ramen!!

I love this place. I always get the Ebi Fry Curry Don. The portions are on point and the food is so delicious and so filling. This place is one of my favorites. The poke´ bowl is awesome, fresh ahi. My family and I love it. We come at least 1-2 month as a treat!

Visited Omoide yesterday.  I really wanted fried rice and an eggs but because it was lunch and I didn't want to much food as I would with the Hawaiian plate lunch places, I decided on Omoide.  

During this visit, I got the shrimp tempura don, the closest I was going to get to fried rice and eggs.  The order was $12.  However, I learned that it comes with miso soup and salad.

Customer service was great.  Restaurant was clean and appealing - lots to look at.  I thought it was really tasty and looking forward to my next visit.

The decor is AMAZING! Who ever decorated the place gets 10 stars! 
I ordered the spicy Tonkatsu, and so did my boyfriend. It was DELICIOUS! The cook even gave us free Tamago. 

I will definitely be back, if anything just to hangout in the decor again!

I really like the interior decor and vibe here.

Food and service are pretty good granted I've never been here during busy hours. 

I usually get the ten zaru noodles with mixed veggie tempura. Never disappointed probably because its hard to mess up such a simple dish.

Mushroom medley is always good, they add spinach to it which I like.
I love Asian food and saw this place when I moved to this side of town. The food was meh and BLAND RAMEN!!! But I guess I'll give it another shot.

I have been here a few times but sadly don't remember the taste of their ramen, haha. I'll have to go back and give it a try. But my recent visit I ordered a bunch ! Such as tonkatsu don, onigiri with crab and a potato croquette. All which were so delicious I got already full with eating the onigiri and croquette I had to take some of my tonkatsu don home lol. The restaurant environment is very chill. Whenever I visit it is barely busy but definitely enjoyable to have some quality time with family and friends. The service was pretty good so I definitely recommend trying it out if you're in the mood for some ramen, rice bowls, appetizers and much more !

I wanted to love this place. But it wasn't anything special and the server wasn't very friendly. I MIGHT come again just because it's so close to my place but don't count on it. I think I'm more willing to make the 20 minute drive to Jinya, Monta, or Ramen Sora

Highly Disappointing.  We live right behind it and was excited to have a new eatery but won't be recommending it.  Maybe we ordered the wrong thing but should there be a wrong thing?  we had shrimp tempura noodles and potato croquette.  The tempura was sitting in a bowl of broth so it was disgustingly soggy on the bottom and by the time we ate it, the broth had saturated the tempura so it was shrimp in soggy batter. The broth had little flavor and left a sour taste in our mouths. I've never left a Japanese eatery rushing home to brush my teeth until today. The potato croquette was ok if you like paying for a premium for a mashed potato blend that's been fried. that's all it was.  For the money not worth it.  Also we both got sick to our stomachs within an hour of eating there.  Not good at all. Service was fine.  the only reason I gave it 2 stars instead of 1 is that I'm hoping they improve but at this point, would not go back!

This was my first time trying authentic noodles and it was really good. It is a cozy not so big.  restaurant with a decent menu. We weren't the only ones in the restaurant but came at good time it seemed to pick up as we were closer to finishing our meals. The server was alone and had to juggle all the tables so we did have a bit of a wait between her visits but they were frequent enough to not feel lost with the other groups. This is a place If you are new to noodles you should bring someone with you who knows the dishes. We spent alot of time looking up each ingredient as there were no translations on the menu. I ended up with a curry bowl and it was a bit on the heavy side with okay flavor. I also tried their miso soup which I love but it was a bit bland. Their drink menu was pretty much non existent there were only 2 kinds of sake. Overall it was an okay experience. I am a foodie so if someone said hey let's go here I would go again but it would not be a place I would pick oh my own.

This place was really good, I absolutely loved the ambiance of the place and most of all the flavor was there. I am not Japanese but this ramen made me feel like I was getting a hug from my grandmother. I am Latina and yet this reminds me of something from my childhood which is odd but somehow it does. The broth is not greasy and not super salty, just the right amount of everything. The egg was perfectly cooked and I just enjoyed every second of it. I will definitely be coming back again. I also cannot wait to try their dessert, I have heard wonderful things.

Also the people were all very polite, helpful and friendly. You can't beat that.

Open until 1am! Yay! Love that this ramen place is near us and away from Chinatown. I liked their ramen. I got the tonkotsu ramen and the flavor of the broth was very hearty and delicious. I liked that they include the bamboo in their ramen dish unlike some other ramen spots in Vegas. Whenever I've had ramen in Japan the bamboo shoots always came with. Also the chashu was very tender as well. I forgot to ask for an egg with my ramen though, didn't realize it didn't come with one. Oh well. 

Service was excellent.  Happy hour drink specials were fun with the buy one, get one free beer and house sake special and the ramen was delish. First time here and definitely not my last.

So the other day, I went to check out a nice ramen noodle shop called Omoide off of south Rainbow and Robindale for lunch. I do like the fact that it is pretty close to my work......but what about everything else?

THE DECOR (4 out of 5)
It was pretty nice walking into this new restaurant. Lots of seating and really high vaulted ceilings made it feel really spacious. That and a lot of Japanese touches (even Japanese ads) that made it feel kind of fun.

THE SERVICE (4 out of 5)
Pretty good service from the wait staff here. Didn't really have to wait too long to get our food and refills on my water were plentiful.

THE FOOD (4 out of 5)
So, let's get down to it, shall we? I had ordered an app of their karaage (think Japanese fried chicken nuggets) which was pretty good although, I kind of like the karaage from Fukumimi better. And then I had the Tonkotsu Shoyu ramen (like I usually get from Monta) and it was pretty good too. The veggies and the pork chashu were good, but as far as the flavor of the actual ramen broth, I really prefer Monta's ramen broth instead. Maybe it's because I'm a big salt kind of guy, I dunno. The good part though for Omoide is that they have a lot of stuff on the menu like udon or soba noodles (both hold and cold), katsu don, etc. So, I'm looking forward to trying out their other dishes.

*UPDATE* I went to Omoide for lunch again last week and had the Tonkatsu Curry Don, which was really good. 

OVERALL (4 out of 5)
So, if you're in the Southwest part of town and are looking for some good eats, be sure to check out Omoide. However, if you're looking for the best ramen out there and don't mind waiting, then Monta or Monta Chaya (in my opinion) are where you should go.

I ordered Tonkatsu w/ egg ($7.50 for the soup + $1.5 for the egg)

I have pretty high expectations for ramen places, and Omoide met those expectations! 

It's a cute little restaurant, but seating size is grander than most ramen places I've been to. The soup I ordered was delicious - Tonkatsu! The soup base was creamy, had sufficient noodles & sides, but extra meat wouldn't hurt. However, overall, the entire dish was a good portion size & filling.

The only negative would be that their hot tea is $1.50 w/ free refills, where other places give this as complimentary. 
However, despite this, I'd still come back here to try their other ramen flavors & curry bowls.

Went here yesterday looking for a quick lunch.  Had a bowl of the chaschu miso ramen.  Wow, great miso broth, tender noodles and very succulent pieces of chaschu pork that were tender and thinly sliced.  Very spacious and nice decor.  The two waitresses were great making recommendations and checking in to make everything was ok.  Will definately be back next time Im on the west side of town.

My friend and I was craving something soupy one late night and stumbled upon this place. When I first walked in I was kind of surprised as to how nice the inside of the restaurant was. I ordered the Miso Tonkatsu Ramen while she got the Shoyu Tonkatsu Ramen. We both came into an agreement that our dishes were nothing to note home about. Flavor and portion was okay as well as the price range. It doesn't pack in much flavor compared to other noddle joints. 

If I remember correctly their hot tea was rice tea and I enjoyed sipping on that through the cold night.

Our server was very attentive. She was also kind whenever we'd ask her questions, requests, and suggestions.
First time here. Ordered the beef steak Don, tako yaki.Overall the food was really good. The place was really cute, def loved the high ceilings. I would def come back here again.
Service was great,but food was too bad. My wife got a food poison right away after eating.
Had a great lunch with baba in this place. Lots of selections for easy dining. Ramen was great and also some other Japanese favs. Make sure to try out their lunch specials

I love this menu! There is always something to fix that japanese craving you have. I wish this place had a better rating, because I didn't come here for the longest time because of their rating wasn't high enough. But this is a 5 star inexpensive japanese restaurant with a great ramen, udon and soba menu. Their appetizer menu is also 2 pages and sometimes I just order off it.

Oh I like this place! Nice decor & great food. At first I was suspicious of this place because of rather low ratings. 
My husband & I had curry tonkatsu don & eby fry don and these are really beyond expectation. 
We havent tried ramen so this review is about their don menu. Maybe next time I will try their ramen and leave the following review.
My go to ramen place. Customer service is amazing. They make my ramen the same way same quality and flavor all the time!

I have to say it was really nice to get to know different food I enjoy very much They have all different kind of flavors that I don't really know but I took the chance and I enjoy they have good customer service in good taste of the food I will come back again and let my family tried that too.............

Me and my Girlfriend went here during dinner time. This place is awesome! Great food and Excellent Customer service! The food quality was excellent served fresh and tasty! I would definitely come back to this place! Oh ohh i ordered Tempura shrimp ramen!

This is a great place to experience authentic Japanese Noodles. The name stands for Memories and they make good ones.  

I had cold noodles and my wife had Miso soup. Happy Hour is 20% off on everything.  
Try it you will like it.

First visit here, I believe it just opened not too long ago. We arrived at 2:30.

Environment: The inside is clean and ventilation is great, no smell from the kitchen at all, especially no frying oil smell.

Service: Very good. We were acknowledged and seated immediately. Menu and water was provided before the server walked away to another table. The food came out quickly and our server came back numerous times to clear off emptied dishes, refilled our drinks, and made sure everything was fine.

Food: We ordered, Gyoza, Cold Tofu, Potato Croquette, Edamame, Kitsune (Bean curd Udon), and Buta Shio Bukkake (Pork belly Soba).
Potato Croquette was fried perfectly, crispy and doesn't fall apart.
Kitsune, the noodles were great. Soft yet chewy, just like udon should be. The soup, however, was a little saltier than it should be for this dish.
Buta Shio Bukkake, the Soba was made perfectly and sauce was good too. I must say, the pork belly was made very very good, crispy with lots of flavor.

We will definitely be back to try other things on the menu. Donburi (rice bowl)next.
Great value, good service, tasty food. Nice local Japanese restaurant in the southwest.

I was just driving around and noticed the big fancy noodles sign, so I decided to go and see what it's all about. Their lot was full of cars so I assume it is trending. When I walk-in, I felt this whole traditional Japanese scenery like I'm in a movie where ninjas will pop out. What caught my eyes right away was the display of paper lanterns hanging on the ceiling. The restaurant's lighting is dim, so it gives that intimate feeling with your partner or your food if you like your privacy that way lol.  It also brings out the beauty in all the lanterns hung above. I also found the bar unique too! It looks like a traditional outdoor food cart.  

 After walking in, I was immediately seated and provided a menu. She brought out water without me requesting it, as it should be standard. She gave me some time to look at the menu and asked if I had any questions regarding. There item selections because it was my first time. She recommended a noodle bowl with a rice ball side order that compliments my main dish.  

  I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen Bowl $12, a beef rice ball and crab mix rice ball $5 (2 pcs). The orders came out quick and hot, leaving my wait time a satisfactory 
She was also quick to provide the spices and sauces for my meal. Communication was there and her ability to see cues on the customers needs was great.  

 I would definitely like to come back and make this my "go to spot" because it offers so much more on the variety of noodle bowls along with the many amazing appetizers. The bonus for me was also the spacious and private seating and more tables compared to most noodle places, so I don't feel crammed here.

Fantastic poke.  Had a large bowl with tuna, salmon and octopus on top of greens and loaded with extras.  Quality fish and excellent service. We'll be back often.  As a bonus they have 2 for 1 beer and sake after 7 pm

Just an update....food is still good here. Been coming by often. I dropped to 4 stars because the service here is super slow even when restaurant is not full. They either need more workers or figure something out. Restaurant ain't even that big for them too be this slow

No longer do you have to drive the treacherous roads of Chinatown to enjoy a bowl of hot ramen or rice bowl. This new Japanese-style noodle and rice bowl place is near Rainbow and the 215. 

Omoide definitely has a home-y feel to it. It looks cool from the outside, and the interior looks even better. Japanese decorations adorn the wall and the lighting is a bit dim, but perfect to enjoy dinner with company. It sort of makes me think of a modern day version of a noodle house. Everything is clean and organized, and workers had a smile on their faces.
Menus are presented in an unconventional clipboard and paper combination.

The waiter we had was friendly and he didn't seem to mind to educate us on the menu items. He also made sure our glasses were never empty and brought us a glass of ice to put in our drinks.

The music playing went along with the environment of the place, which was very pleasing to experience. 

We ordered the chicken karaage don and the beef steak don. The beef steak don was cooked to your choice of temperature, but the taste of it with the ginger sauce (I think) was a bit weird. The chicken karaage was better tasting and was a bigger portion. Miso soup was on point and the salad tasted amazing even though it looked a little plain. 

If you do decide to get dessert after eating, try the black sesame ice cream. It has a nutty flavor, yet a subtle sweetness to make it a perfect combination of flavors after eating a filling, well-portioned meal here. 

Comment cards were offered to us after the meal because they wanted to see how they were doing since they're a new business in town.
The bowl didn't look like the picture. The shrimp was soggy and the egg was disappointing.
Spicy ramen was to die for love this place. Keep up the good work guys. You won't be disappointed

My son and I had dinner here tonight and I believe we found a hidden gem!  I ordered a poke salad which turned out  to be so good!  My sons ramin soup was also a quality meal. To top it off we had honey.....OMG....soooo good!!!!!!

If you ever been to Japan and some delicious food there, then this place is just like it. I love the decorations in here, it reminded me so much of when I went to Japan. 

I ordered the tempura udon, it tasted like it was missing something so I asked for a side of ponzu sauce and mmmmm it make it 500% better! The noodles was cooked very well and the shrimp tempura was yummy. 

I wanted to try their Chicken Curry but didn't want to order a lot of. The great thing is they have these small orders (rice bowl size) for under $5. I added corn to make it more my type of a curry bowl. I would have to say, the curry flavor was really delicious. It wasn't too strong and didn't over power the whole dish. The bowl could have used a little more chicken but other than that, I recommend it. 

The environment is pretty intimate. The chairs/tables are near one another so if your heading here on a date, it's nice but don't be shy with your conversations cause everyone will hear you lol

Enjoy!

Cute little quiet place for late night tapas or ramen. I came for the tapas tonight. Also Beer & sake specials late night. Buy one get one. I ordered the tofu steak sizzling plate,Bomb. Chicken karage,bomb. My fav was chashu bun, BOMB! lol definitely a must try spot.

Literally. Too full. To type. Just kidding, amazing portions, legit enough to make it to #2 of my "best tasting ramen in vegas" and the servers are nice friendly and nurturing. Yes, nurturing! Definitely a plus for the experience... not to mention the genius lantern chandelier centerpiece that they have that makes the ambience all the more a reason to visit this place... i gotta say, found one close to home... chinatown, eat your heart out
ramen and Japanese curry til the wee hours?! and it's near my house?! sold. good people, tasty food, and a decent late night happy hour. see you tonight, Omoide!

We had a very strange experience here. There seemed to be a little bit of a language barrier although she was really nice. The appetizers were ok, the only huge complaint I have was the broth in the actual soup. It was so bland and flavorless. It definitely needs to be spruced up: I ordered the shrimp tempera soup and the shrimp was placed on top of the soup so by the time you eat the shrimp they are completely soggy and ruined. The music and ambiance was cool but the lights needed to be slightly dimmed. If they would work on the flavor of the soup we might consider coming back.

Food Quality:3.5 
service: 3.8
ambience and decors:3.8
cleaniness:3.7 so final rating 3.8
They say the are open til 1 am but I got there at 1145 and they said they were closing up. I hate it when restaurant false advertise the times they are open
After attending many pho and ramen spots in town .  Omoide Noodles Bowls has a unique vide and atmosphere. Cheap menu but not cheap in taste.

Service: Ok. Wait time to get food and check took 20 lifetimes and it was empty!
The food: Tako yaki was good. chicken wings were also good. They only have pork broth ramen (tonkotsu) and one vegetarian miso ramen. I tried some of the vegetarian miso ramen and it was bland and salty. I ordered the tonkotsu ramen and it was literally the worst I've ever had. Just go to Jinya, they have better service and much better ramen.
Not the best ramen.  Good Japanese tapas variety. Curry, ramen and bunch of apps.  Open till 1am now too.  HH drinks specials on beer and sake.  It's buy 1, get 1

First time here tonight. I heard so much good things about this place. My experience was not great and neither was the experience of my companions - there was a foul sewer smell filtering in inside of the restaurant and we waited what seemed like forever for our ramen soups (it had to be around 30 mins or more) do not worth the wait - not as flavorful as I have had at other ramen joints. When we asked why it's taking so long, the servers said they are backed up in the kitchen which there were only two- three tables of 2-3 people. The rice bowls two our companions ordered came out in decent time. One a good thing was the salmon sashimi was fresh. Unfortunately I will not be dining here again!!!!

Recently opened, this restaurant is located in Southwest side of Vegas. As the name of the restaurant "Omoide Noodles & Bowls" says, their menu mainly consist of noodles (choice of udon/soba in either hot/cold) and bowls with few appetizers. 

ATMOSPHERE
The atmosphere of this place itself deserves 5 stars. The interior resembles a lot like Omoide Yokocho in Sinjuku or Dotonburi Yokocho in Osaka. Just like the name "Omoide" which means memories, I was having a nostalgic moment as soon as I walked in. Aw, I would just come here just to sit and enjoy the atmosphere.

SERVICE
Quick, attentive and friendly. Servers here were all smiling and were quick to refill water/constantly asking if we are doing ok. 

FOOD
I was craving some cold noodles and went with Shio Buta Bukkake. I went with Udon instead of soba. Food arrived within 10 mins. I looked at my bowl and was surprised at how simple it looked. Udon in tsuyu, with green onions and few pieces of shio buta on the side. 

The soup, or tsuyu was on the saltier side but overall had a lot of flavor even though it looked so simple. I realized halfway that there were some yuzu kosho (seasoning made of yuzu peel, pepper and salt. Citrusy and refreshing) on the shio buta. If you get the Shio Buta Bukkake, then I advise you to mix the green onions and yuzu kosho together. Makes it more flavorful! As much as I loved this, portion was small and soup was too salty for my taste. 

In addition to the bowl of noodle, I also ordered tempura mix. Mmh..for $6, definitely not worth it. Unless you are craving tempura, I would not order this. Few pieces of shrimp, along with vegetable tempura. It was just ok. 

CONCLUSION
Would like to see more options on the menu. I would like to see tsukemen added to the menu since they mainly serve noodles and rice bowls, but just a suggestion. Will return again!

Late night food place for Asian food cravings!!! This is your spot. My friend and I were craving ramen or udon, and this place happens to have both!! Located southwest area of Las Vegas. The sign says "noodles and bowls" so not only do they have noodle soup, but also curry bowls, and poke bowls. They have a little bit of everything! 9-1 is happy hour, but one get one free beer. I'll definitely have to come back and try the rest! We came around 10 and the place was packed, definitely speaks to the restaurant.

The ambiance and interior design of this restaurant is very appealing. The customer service was great and the servers were very attentive. Unfortunately, I'd have to say that the food was mediocre. Our table ordered 3 different curry bowls and the chicken were soggy. Taste was pretty good though. The miso soup that came with my entree was warm. I was looking forward to hot soup since the weather is nice and cold outside. My wife ordered Ramen. It wasn't bad at all but the nitomago was sub-par. It made the entire dish seem cheap and poorly put together. There is plenty of parking outside but it can get busy due to the other very popular restaurants in the same plaza. I probably won't be coming back here if I was craving some Japanese food.

This place has yet to disappoint! Found this place in February and seems to have me coming almost every week sometimes 2-3 days a week. Food is amazing definitely high quality Japanese comfort food. Service is quick and servers are kind and courteous.
Sadly the quality has gone down. The veggies haven't been fresh and the service isn't improving. Quite a bummer as I was hoping things had improved since.

Everything we've tried here is delicious!!! We came late, 9:30 pm they close at 10pm and just had to come back the next day to try more of their selections. Everything came out fast and hot at both of our visits. We really enjoyed everything we tried and have adopted this as our new spot! People were still coming in past 10pm. 

LA style poke - I really felt this was a great value $8 or $12  
Pumpkin croquette - love love love this! 
Goyza - perfectly cooked topped with green onion 
Chicken katsu on a bed of rice
Ramen bowl with pork - fantastic flavor!
Chicken bites on a bed of rice - tender and delicious perfect for kids!

This place is soooooo good and I love the decor of the restaurant. I feel like I am back in Japan. I am from New Orleans and we do not have a lot of ramen spots to eat at. The staff were friendly and we were greeted and seated right away. Our food came out really fast and hot. The proportion are very generous and we were full. We may have ordered a lot, but it was so good. I would def come again whenever I'm back in Vegas.

Worst service we've experienced in years! 

Almost left because it took too long to take our order. 
Brings out the wrong poke bowl. 
Forgets to bring my Miso soup.  
Refills the water when our iced teas are empty. 
Finally brings Miso after I ask for it, and hands it over my shoulder, from behind, reaching over their half wall! Wtf?!? Who does that with anything, much less a steaming cup of soup?!?
And the poke bowl game out the second time with seaweed salad. Something we asked not to have.  Twice! 

Only good thing was my wife's Ramen, the spicy tonkotsu miso.

This place is super cute but the menu is small and they don't offer any katsu but pork. I wish I'd known that before I drove the 20 minutes since I don't eat pork. I've never been to a katsu/noodle place that didn't offer chicken. My husband got the pork and said it was chewy (ewww) I got like a popcorn chicken thing and it was soggy.

This place just opened up and is exactly what this area needed! I had the tonkotsu shoyu ramen and added corn and egg to it. Amazing! I would have taken a photo, but devoured the bowl before I thought about it. Will be back very often!
Great place for Japanese! Prices amazing and food was great. Customer service on point.

This place has a wonderful atmosphere and cute decorations. We ordered take out from here and it was incredible! I wish we could have stayed to eat. The server kept checking on us to see if we were ready to place our order to go. It was packaged very well. The food was pretty good. The poke bowl was much better than my noodles. However, the flavor is all there. The texture was off in some places but overall, I would come back here over and over again.

when it first opened, it used to be so good, everything used to be so perfect, but WHAT HAD HAPPENED? they have made some really poor choice over last couple of time I went there.  
1. We got disappointed on our favorite karaage chicken, it used to be very lightly fried with thin breading skin, chicken itself isn't salty at all, but still tasty, right now they claimed they used some new thick breading outside of chicken, it's also super salty, I do not like it at all, I cannot believe someone pass this decision, it was the most horrible decision they've ever made.

2. after being disappointed by karaage chicken, we have to find something else now..so we gave their pork bun a try.....it's good, except the pork I got in my pork bun was literally PAPER THIN with mostly breading and almost no meat, I'm not joking guys, I compare my pork meat with the picture on their menu, which looks just like a generous thick cut, it looks NOTHING like it at all, when I talked to waitress they just politely apologize, although I didn't expect them to give me money back....but...not even effort of remaking me a new one? wow, there goes another star

after these 2 times....I'm sad to say that they have loose two loyal customer(more customers, because I will not recommend my friend to go there anymore).  Good bye omoide, time to go back to good old Sora and Monta :(

Came across this place driving from Henderson since Monta Chaya was a 45 min wait. Saw this on Rainbow Blvd and decided to stop here and try it. 

Off the bat when walking in, the atmosphere was really nice. Had that Japan feel like eating at an alley of Japan which was a nice feeling! Even had a little noodle bar. Only thing is it was a little chilly I guess they didn't have the heater on, but eating Ramen would warm me up in no time! 

For appetizer I ordered the Tuna Sashimi ($10) which took a little time to get to me. It tasted fresh and not stringy at all like some tunas would. Was so creamy and had 3 different kind of seaweeds. Was quite interesting especially the clear looking one. It was yummy. 

For Ramen I got the Tonkoysu Miso ($7.75) with toppings of Nori ($.75), and Egg ($1.50). As I was waiting for my order, I totally forgot to add the butter, but once I tasted my ramen, it was so yummy and buttery already and didn't need it anymore. It was so tasteful and yet so light. It came with the usual veggies/bamboo shoots and chashu. Although I didn't taste much garlic which I love with ramen. 
Hubby and son ordered the Ton Katsu Curry Don. ($10.00) came with a side salad with ginger dressing and miso soup. The curry and chicken together was such a good flavor and perfect spiciness. By this time nothing can go wrong with the food. Everything was delicious. 

Why only 3 stars? Well the food took more time to come out than other usual ramen places. We also had ordered 3 pork buns as appetizer, but never came out and had to cancel the order since it was put on our bill. It was really chilly inside the restaurant even after eating my Ramen and being the fact that I had to eat with my jacket on was super uncomfortable. And lastly, for being an Izakaya, they didn't have much options on their menu as other Izakayas. Other than that, our server was great and super happy with all the food we got. Will definitely be back for more.

Seems like they changed up the interior since the last time I came here. They have booths now on the left side of the entrance! 

If you're a newbie to Omoide, and have a craving for curry late at night, definitely try their ton katsu curry don. The pork cutlets melt in your mouth! A delicious surprise for me as it reminded me of a closed establishment years ago that had a similar dish (however I couldn't find any place that served it anywhere in Vegas for the life of me). Not until stepping into this quaint little joint. 

Ton Katsu Curry Don consists of a generous amount of pork cutlets, white rice that consistently doesn't get too sticky or hard in texture, slices of red ginger, and a less than wholesome amount of curry sauce all over. It always comes with a soup and salad, whether you order dine in or to go.  

Apparently they have tonkotsu ramen with black garlic oil (but only limited to one specific ramen), which I tried briefly with a few friends however flavorful it may be, it wasn't anything out of the ordinary. Their late night Japanese beer specials are definitely noteworthy though!

Well the service is great. We were there on a Saturday at lunch and there was one waitress for the entire restaurant.  She did a fantastic job with serving, clearing tables, etc.  However, overall the food was okay nothing great.  Katsu curry was tasty but strong, katsudon was okay.  Gyoza was tasty. Big issue is cleanliness. Salt and pepper shakers and soy sauce plate were sticky and dirty.  Looks like cleanliness leaves something to,be desired.  With one waitress, how can she do everything and clean up too?  Also what looked like a counter for customers with utensils and napkins laid out has a curtain front of it but you can see supplies behind the curtain. Would hope they don't seat customers there, I wouldn't sit there and stare at a curtain while I'm eating.  So the place needs work definitely start with cleanliness.

I am fairly impressed with Omoide! Thank you to Charity for posting pics of the menu. I saw that this place just opened and what better time to try it then on a cold Saturday May night. I made my husband pick it up and he was excited that he could stop by Lee's if he wasn't in the mood for noodles. 

They just opened yesterday and when we called the first time there was no answer but they finally answered and we were able to order. My tonkatsu shoyu was more tonkatsu than shoyu but it was creamy and flavorful. I'm a bit thirsty after it but I assume it's just from the saltiness? The noodles were precooked in the to go box which could be a good thing or bad thing. They should probably offer an option of doing either or. Luckily the noodles were cooked al dente so when the noodles and soup were combined it wasn't a bunch of soggy noodles. The bamboo pieces were hard to eat but I definitely like the charsui. The onigri was ok. Nothing to go crazy about but it's a nice filler. 

Overall, I'm glad they are opening more places around the southwest so we don't have to make the trek down to Chinatown. I'm definitely coming back when I feel the need to eat ramen. =)

Omoide had a really nice atmosphere and looks much different from other Japanese Restaurants I've been.  They have the usual ramen counter, but it's quite a small section.

At first I thought the name meant 'Heavy' since Omoi means Heavy in Japanese, but when I saw the word Omoide in kanji I realized it means likes to Reminisce or to remember memories.

They have a variety of food to choose from: Udon, Ramen, Gyuudon (Meat Bowl), etc.  My friends and I chose this place to try their ramen. The last time I went, I saw that they also have Poke Bowls which was new to me since the last time I went to Omoide.

I had the Tonkatsu Miso while my other friends had the regular Tonkatsu. The ramen had the usual meat, bamboo, and seaweed.  It also consist of thin type of noodles.  Overall, it was delicious~  It tasted similar to other Ramen restaurants I've been too.

It was a nice experience, would go again to try out their other foods~

Omoide means "memory" in Japanese. The restaurant is CUTE. I wouldn't say it's very Japanese, but it's a good and cute attempt. Definitely kawaii. 
Why the low reviews, Yelp? The 2 dishes I tried were both good. There aren't very many non-sushi Japanese restaurants in Vegas, but this one makes up for it. Authentic items on the menu, but they didn't taste authentic. But that doesn't mean they didn't taste good. 
Chashu bowl: Fatty pork, but that melt in your mouth kind of fat. Not the chewy stuck in your mouth kind of fat. Heavily flavored and dripping sauce into the rice. A plus. 
Ebi-don. Oyako-don, but with tempura shrimp instead of chicken. They don't usually serve it with tempura shrimp in Japan, but I can see the appeal.Very filling. Both dishes came with a salad, soup and pickled veggies. 
They have a lunch special where you can order a noodle and rice dish with a soda. Super cheap and an easy carry out too!

I love the interior, a nice transitional look. The food on the other hand is so-so, it's not bad but it's not extraordinary either. My server was also very nice but since my friends and I did stay a while we felt like they wanted us to leave already lol

Amazing spot, super healthy but still very tasty. 
Even the lychee beer is delicious. The Nigori Strawberry  sake is sweet & delicious, it tastes almost like  milk shake .

I really liked the place.  It was cute and decorated up like a streetcorner.  Our food arrived quickly and was delicious.  I was disappointed there were few veggies in the ramen but the flavor was fantastic (lack of veggies cost one star).  Price was on-point and affordable.  Service was quick.  I would recommend this restaurant to others who want a quick bite at lunch.

Omoide means dream in Japanese.

Our large group rotated in on a Sunday afternoon after a long holiday weekend of rock climbing. We appreciated the warmth, especially the extra warm restrooms, that gave flashbacks to the warm heated toilet seats in Japan. These toilet seats weren't heated but the adorable little bathroom space was extra warm and cozy.

This ramen shop was conveniently located off the freeway on the drive back to Southern California. Our group arrived and departed in staggered times which probably made it easier for the restaurant to manage. 

There were vegetarian options for those that didn't eat meat and they were still hearty, warm and satisfying ramen. The majority of the party ordered the spicy tonkatsu ramen and added an egg. Some people didn't get eggs as the kitchen ran out but we weren't charged for them. 

A big thumbs up for the service that tried their best to accommodate our group.

Not too impressed with this place. My friends ordered the ramen and I ordered the udon. My udon just came with noodles, a lot of green onion and some pork. I've had way better udon noodles. My friends ordered their ramen and they were like where is the egg? It was pretty plain and they charge you extra for everything while at the other ramen places it's included. The positive thing is this place is open late that's what attracted us to go to it.

In Vegas, it seems like the benchmark is Monta Ramen on Spring Mt. so I'm going to review this place in comparison. 

1. Environment: with plenty of room and vaulted ceilings the environment is very nice. 
2. Service: I didn't request for a lot and I don't have complaints
3. Soup base: I actually like the soup here more. The flavor of the Tonkotsu was more subtle and not as overbearing with the salt. 
4. Noodles: It tastes store bought, nothing special. 
5. Chashu pork: Compared to Monta, unremarkable. It was a bit course and flavorless in comparison. 
6. Price: 1 bowl of Ramen with 2 toppings was $11

Overall, I will come back again. It's a good lunch spot on this side of town.

Been looking for a legit spot for ramen and I can finally say "I FOUND IT!" Anything in the menu I highly recommend. I tried the Spicy Tonkatsu and it was AMAZING, the spice was on point! Like really on POINT! Was super spicy one sec then it's okay the next! To perfect to describe. Lol anyways!!!  The place is super nice, amazing staff, fun to look at and be at. Location is great Cuz I live on the same street lol. You will definitely see me here twice a week or more. Ramen is life bro.

All its missing is a better dessert menu, food is great here, the staff is friendly and can explain anything you don't understand. They changed the menu and added more. Awesome buy one get one free happy hour. Udon, ramen hot and cold, curry, eggs, tempura are good... its comforting... cute interior decor...

Excellent ramen and great service! I had the spicy miso ramen and I can't get over how much flavor the broth had. The pork was also very tender and tasty. Service was quicker than expected and our waitress was friendly.
This place reminds me of Japan and I really love it! Nice atmosphere, great selections of food, and they all taste amazing too! I loved their beef tataki. So amazing!! The best I've ever had before!

Omoide is my favorite place to go! The LA style poke bowls are AMAZING and their Karaage chicken is sooo good! Also the servers are so personable that they remember the little things like extra sauce without me having to ask. There has not been one time that I've came here and was disappointed.

This was genuinely a go to the spot for me. I couldn't even count the amount of people that I've introduced to this place, it'd be hard to calculate the hundreds (plural) of dollars I spent at this place overtime. Last night, both myself and my coworker were very disappointed.

It's almost religious I order the same thing at this place (The only exception is when I'm feeling dangerous and order a honey bread for dessert). It's always Ramen and a side order of shrimp tempura. The shrimp comes in a set of two for three dollars and while I'm personally not the biggest fan of the price, I pay it anyway every time because I just happen to love shrimp tempura. Last night, however... When I received my order, it was noticeably smaller to both myself and my coworker who comes with me all the time. 

Seriously, if you look at my last review, it was five stars and I'm pretty sure I even mentioned it was arguably my favorite restaurant. Not anymore. I brought it to the waiter's attention upon delivery and he scoffed at me and said "they always come in this size." They don't... They seriously don't. If I was cheap and just trying to get free things, I would've complained that there is some hair in my soup or something. I've never complained here before in the countless times I've been here, i've always been polite to everybody. I've always been easy to please. 

This is the one time (over a three dollar item) that I had ever spoken up about anything and I was argued with and scoffed at. I didn't even ask for them for free, I just wanted them exchanged for some regular sized shrimp if I was going to pay the three dollars I always pay for it. That type of guest service put enough of a bad taste in my mouth that I have become fairly confident I'm never going to come here again. This was a bill over $40 (including tip, because I'm not an animal) you would think more effort would have been placed forward to retain a VERY loyal guest's business but instead they are now trained to argue baby shrimps till their death.

First time trying this place.  I always pass by and wondered.  Not bad, I had the raman - Tonkatsu/Shoyu and beef tataki for appetizer.  Raman was OK and the beef tataki was tasty.  I may come back to try other items on the menu.

Love this place ! 
The lunch special is very worth it. 12$ for your choice of ramen with a side dish, a salad and soda of your choice.
Honestly such a good deal and so tasty !!!
The soup was a bit too salty for me but it's ok.

Sooooo my boyfriend and I just left this place completely dissatisfied. Being a huge fan of Monta and Sora, we wanted to try this place out since it's closer to our houses. 

First, service took FOREVER. And I'm not exaggerating. A couple seated next to us, left because their dishes were taking too long as well. Anyways, it took them twenty minutes to give us our first ramen dish. And I had to wait an additional fifteen minutes for my pork belly miso bowl to arrive. And lastly, the gyoza came after another five or so minutes. And there was no communication between the servers at all. We got the bill twice at the end of our meal. 


If the service wasn't bad enough, the food was below mediocre. The broth for the miso ramen tasted like it came from powder. The so-called udon noodles looked and tasted like hydrated ramen noodles. Both bowls were oily as well. 


Definitely NEVER going back. Drive to Monta or Sora instead!!!!

A solid 3. Nicely decorated and great music. We both had Tonkatsu ramen. I got the spicy one. Overall the food was ok, but for the price and closeness to home I wouldn't mind coming back.  I was bummed my first two mochi flavors were out and I had to settle for chocolate.

I think I need to give this place another shot..I was just not that impressed.  

Ambiance, I liked how they changed up the place and made it very welcoming with all the open space.  

As far as my meal, I ordered the beef bowl and I felt like I could make it at home.  It bately had any taste or flavor.  If I am going to spend money, I really want to make sure it's something I'm totally excited about forking over the dough.  

I was really looking forward to this place opening up and had high expectations....darn it.   

Don't get me wrong,  the service was great and my server was very kind and helpful,  but the food was just not a hit for me.

I'm going to try and give this place another try and hope and cross my fingers I find their magical dish that will make me return.
Great food. Awesome choices. Good service!!

Wanted to try a new ramen place and didn't know what expect. The service was absolutely terrible besides constantly getting water refills the wait time for a party of six to receive their order was way too long for having no one there but three other parties of two. The ramen was mediocre at best and it was a complete let down service wise. The girl servers couldn't give a ETA on how long more for our orders after waiting about 30 mins.

Very cute vibe inside.  Reminds me of Spirited Away.  The service was perfect and the staff friendly.  The food has gotten a lot better from the time I ate there when it just opened.  

I got the cold soba Ten Iso (tempura) noodle.  I craved something savory and cold to beat his summer heat.  Also ordered the crab, beef and plum onigiri (rice balls) and the grilled squid.  None disappointed.  Highly suggest the crab mix onigiri to you guys and definitely the cold soba.

GET THE BLACK SESAME ICE CREAM HERE.  The consistency is so perfect, its so smooth, cold, and hard at the same time.  Its really hard to find excellent and superb ice cream consistency in life and this place has it for the black sesame.  Dont get the red bean unless you a fool.  

The ramen is aight and the soba is expensive.  Noodles are pretty good tho.  have a fantastic day

Nice late night place for ramen & udon. People are super nice. We ordered wakame udon & shoyu tonkatsu ramen with a side of tempura. 
4 stars bc I had to wait 1/2 hr for my order & it wasn't crowded.

Overall the Ramen I just devoured tasted like any other ramen place I've been too, however the flavor was insanely enhanced by the decor and ambience that surrounded me. This place "explodes" with Japanese Culture. Felt like outside were the streets of Japan. Friendly service, quality of food, and the speed were all good in my favor. Will definitely be back!

If you've had Foo Foo Tei in SoCal, you'll be disappointed. 

FOOD:
They basically have ramen in one type of broth only: tonkatsu - and then vegetarian. Toppings that should already be included with the bowl of ramen are not included. I ordered the spicy tonkatsu. Nothing super special. 

PRICES
Considering that a bowl of ramen is already $7.50 to $10, I feel that the toppings such as egg ($1.50) and cha shu ($3) should be included. In the end, I feel that the menu is on the pricier side. 

CUSTOMER SERVICE
My waitress was friendly. Checked on me frequently even though I didn't need anything. 

ENVIRONMENT
Cute decor. They have late night happy hour so it seems like this place can be loud and lively. 

Overall, I wouldn't return. I'm sure I can find better tasting ramen out here in Vegas.

If you want a legit Japanese street food this is the place to go, this place is much more than a typical ramen place you can find in every corner in vegas. The atmosphere makes you feel like you are in Japan, and the dishes are just as great. I tried ebi don this time, the portion is huge and taste is right on spot! not too bland or salty. Our server was very kind and friendly. Definitely coming back to try the cold soba next time!

Order Ten Zaru, Kirin, Salmon Sashimi found my new place for my Zaru Soba. Salmon was fresh cut very decent on customer service side my server Music very polite and very attentive on the way I wanted my Sashimi good job sir. As other Yelpers says the place got an upgrade they now have booths nice for some little privacy me time.
Such a cute little restaurant! Great food and a decent price. It's my new favorite noodle spot

This place rocks!  I will definitely be a regular with it being right down the street. I had two things: Pumpkin Croquette and Spicy Tonakatsu Miso Ramen.  

Spicy Tonakatsu Miso: Full of flavor, spicy but not too spicy, ground meat and great noodles!

Pumpkin Croquettes: AMAZING! Two come in the order.  Nice thin crisp panko crust with sweet and savory pumpkin inside.  I could have eaten twenty of these things.
My first time there.  Stopped on a whim.  The atmosphere is really nice, quite, & very clean.  I love the light feature.  The food was delicious and the service was great.  I'd definitely go again!

I highly recommend this ramen house. I'll be returning.

[CUISINE]
Ebi Tonkatsu Curry Don: Really great, this shrimp curry was served with rice, miso soup and salad. I was too excited to have the curry so I skipped the miso. The salad was light and had a great flavor. The curry was a medium spice which was perfect to me. I don't like overly spicy, I feel it hides the flavors of the food.

Miso Ramen: My husband had this and loved it. I might get it next time but I loved the curry so much I'm not sure.

[DECOR]
Very cute. Has the feel of outdoor japan, with pretty multilevel lanterns overhead showcasing their vaulted ceiling.

[SERVICE]
Upon emptying my water glass it took less than 30 seconds for them to notice and offer a refill. Nice. The servers were very attentive and friendly. Lots of smiles here.

[PRICE]
Great price. My curry was $11.50 and the ramen was about $10. They charge extra for eggs and green onion which is normal. The quality of the food + the environment makes this place a steal. I will be back. Yum!

Recently moved to this side of town and was looking to try out a new Ramen place and was thoroughly surprised with this place. We went at 3pm on a Wednesday. The atmosphere was very pleasant. It had a very calm relaxed vibe to it, which I really enjoyed. I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen and it was very delicious. The service was very friendly and quick. Always made sure our beverages were filled and asked us if we needed anything else. No problems whatsoever. Definitely recommend! 5 stars.

my family and i typically go here, last night we brought a couple of our friends who has never had ramen other than top ramen. we ordered for them because they like what they see in the posts we post. our server was really friendly and funny, he called the chicken karaage, kfc nuggets. the chicken karaage is one of our favorite appetizers and the sauce it comes with is really delicious. 
the ramen we all got and will always get is the tonkotsu ramen and we add our own chili oil to make it spicy. 
i'd give them 5 stars, except waiting to give our order and ask/receive our check took a really long time so for that, 4 stars.

I went here today for a late lunch. It's a very cute place, clean inside and the waitress was attentive. I wasn't impressed at all with the tempura vegetables, super small portion. I did enjoy the Spicy tonkotsu ramen, though it would be nice if the ingredients on the menu were in English and not just Japanese. I would've told them no pork had I known it was in the dish. Another thing I didn't care for is when they brought the bill, they circled the suggested tip area to remind me to tip. That's really tacky.

Wanted to give them 3.5 stars. Parking is easily accessible. Came here mid-afternoon and was able to enjoy their lunch specials. Prizing is adequate for their serving sizes. Place is clean and has nice ambiance. I had fun looking at their decors. Staff is so helpful.

YELP 100 CHALLENGE: #6

Cute decor and theme.  Above average price for dishes especially if you're getting any sushi or poke.  The soup broths are ok, not as great as some top ramen houses in the valley like Monta, Sora, or JINYA in terms of flavor.  Of course, there is never a wait here so that could be a fallback option for some.
I have been waiting for a place like this near my house!! Service is great and the food is even better. I tried the kaarage, gyoza, and spicy tonkatsu ramen. I definitely recommend this place!

This is my fave Asian place to eat at! This is the best place for tapas. I absolutely love onigiri and it makes me so happy that they serve onigiri. My favorite is bonito, or fish flakes. It's also a must to get the takoyaki!!

Every time I come here, I always order udon. I will either get shrimp tempura udon or kitsune udon. However, this time, I changed it up and ordered pork tonkatsu curry. A little spicy for my taste buds but regardless, it was amazing.

The place is aesthetically pleasing, so take pics of the ceiling lights. The entire restaurant is Japanese themed and it's cute af. I feel so at home when I'm eating there lmao
Love the cold noodles and takoyaki! My kids like the poke bowls. I also like that they are open late Mon.-Sat. Lots of my fave kinds of food on the menu.
Just moved to the area, in less than a month we have gone here about 3 times. It's just that good. My favorite is the miso ramen with extra meat. Super super good! Open late which is such a plus!
The food was good very presentable big portions for the ramen and udon bowls.. the price is fairly reasonable and it wasn't that busy which is what I like.. cute little place I would go back

Awesome noodle house! I loved that there was a good selection of various noodles to choose from. I came here with my bestie and I ended up getting the kake w/ soba noodles and she got the tonkatsu. Both were pretty good, I personally liked the soba noodles! The portions and prices are pretty fair. The interior interior was super adorbs! And definitely will be back to try all the other dishes as well! Great space/place to hang out and eat some delicious food!

The flavor of this place is my favorite out of all of the ramen joints in town. However, the waitresses do not write your order down so our waitress had to come back to our table twice and ask for clarification. My food still came out wrong but luckily I'm not super picky so I didn't send it back. The waitresses really need to use pen and paper to take orders so that there aren't any wrong orders that may result in a waste of food.

There are very few places I go to eat where I leave knowing I won't be back. This is one of them.

Service is excellent, no complaints there. Ice tea (green tea) also good.

But now I need to go find mints or something to get the very strong fish flavor out of my mouth. I ordered shrimp tempura and was disappointed that the shrimp were totally immersed in the noodles and broth. Which tasted so fishy that the shrimp were ruined. Soggy, fishy shrimp - not my idea of a satisfying meal.

I have been wanting to try this noodle place for quite a while. Today after leaving IKEA we had a chance. 

A.  Where is everyone?  Came in on a Sunday at about 2:15 pm Amd it is nearly empty in this very good sized noodle shop with plenty of tables and space.  

B.  Service - very nice and attentive staff. Friendly and quick.

C.  Choices. Love this menu.  From the rice dishes, to the noodles, ramen, soba and udon.  Both hot and cold noodles. They even have my favorite Zaru Soba noodles as well.

D.  The food. This is key and three star to me. 

A.  Buta Shio Bukkake Cold Soba- of course I love soba and cold is best.  I first want to know where were the noodles?  They gave me a huge bowl and a small bit of soba.  The soba was perfectly cooked.  Enjoyed it quite a bit.  The grilled pork belly was well very grilled. I found it to be tough and the taste was not flavorful.  The sauce was strong.  Very strong taste.  I know they use Mirin for the sauce but it was over powering. 

B. Tonkatsu Shoyu Ramen- my son ordered this and I had a few bites.  The sauce was very good, ramen just right.  My only issue is that the ramen was swimming in soup and I prefer that it is not.

C.  Hiyashi Chuka - these cold ramen noodles are very good and on a nice warm day just right.  Right amount of ramen and all the toppings were great.  The wifey ordered this and of course I stole some bites.  I look forward to ordering this in future.  

I like this place, the size, the service.  The food could be slightly improved but  it it is good overall.

GK says check it out.

We tried the Chashu Don and Katsu Don. Very delicious! I especially enjoyed the pork belly and kalbi sauce. Very tender. I didn't even eat the miso soup or salad, I was so wrapped up in the rice bowl.

For dessert, HONEY BREAD! If you've never had this, you must... must... must order it. You will not be disappointed!
finally a ramen place in SW, no need to drive to China town, try the tonkotsu ramen, it is okay, nothing spectacular, service on par

The food is just ok. Nothing over the top or spectacular. The food tastes different every time that I have been there. Today I did a To-go order of sashimi and a bun and it took 19 minutes. There was only 2 tables in there and they already had their food when I ordered

Omoide is a hidden gem. It never disappoints. I've yet to find anything they do subpar. They crush ramen, tempura, katsu, chasu, bun....they are a go to. It's rather dangerous I live so close....good thing it's super affordable too!

Just came in for lunch and boy oh boy was it amazing!!! Lunch special was $12 for a full bowl of ramen, salad, side dish and drink (I got the iced green tea - which was made from macha, so good). The decor was like stepping into a little noodle house in Tokyo. I loved it and will be back to try more!!

I was really excited to have a ramen/udon opening up near my house. But was very dissapointed. The noodles wasnt fresh at all, it was a bit hard. my best friend and boyfriend both agreed. The udon noodles werent even udon! udon noodles are suppose to be thick noodles. Not only the noodles werent good but the broth too. Also they claim to close at 1am but in reality when you get there at 12am they tell you that they stop serving.
It was Okay. They have not only ramen but also have cold one, Hot & Cold Udon, Soba noodle. Interesting tapas items.
Awesome food!!! I come here at least once if not twice a week love the gyoza and the mini bowls my wife gets the chicken curry and I enjoy the pork.... And for dessert mochi!!

Food is delicious, service is excellent! I highly recommend this place to everybody! I can't get enough. Everything I eat after having a meal here taste like complete shit compared to this restaurant.
Tonkatsu shoyu ramen and karaage was good. Same sh*t, different place. Just like any other ramen place to me. would eat there again, close to my house.

Among the several ramen places I've been to this place was pretty okay! Their tonkatsu spicy miso broth was amazing but the noodles used were pretty gross. They were like sad curly spaghetti noodles. As a Asian, I was highly disappointed. The nori tasted really bad like that freeze dried out of package taste but the tamago egg was good! Their gyoza was cooked perfectly with an amazing sauce added. Our green tea was disgusting and was watered down sooooo badly.

Prices are fairly normal but their add on prices are a little spiked up.

They filled our waters in a timely manner and our server was really nice. The interior of the restaurant was simply beautiful. Very high ceilings and cute seating arrangements. I will be back to try the shrimp tempura udon!

I tried a small poke bowl and shoyu ramen broth..it was yummy!  Love the menu!  Spacious and intimate. .. it was slow when I came in for lunch but that's why it was perfect for me lol also More food on the menu to choose from then normal.  Will be going back to try other items that looked yummy on the menu lol

The beef bowl was was very tasty. The sliced ribeye stood out especially because of how they were able to infuse a garlic flavor do well. The salad had a unique potato salad which was interstingly different but good. The chicken from my bowl wasn't dry chewy like I'm used too. The 2 Ramen bowls I can't rate because it was for other people I treated and didn't eat with them. Pork is not my preferance so my con about this place is the lack of selection of Ramen since that's what I really wanted to try and have been wanting to ever since this dish craze. All in all not bad if this is your thing, especially for the price.

Ambiance is amazing.
Service: Fast & friendly!!

Although I love ramen, I'm disappointed to say that I've had better. Monta Ramen & Ramen Sora are my personal favorites. It is however convenient for me because it is very close to where I live.

The servers are great as well as the food and the restaurant is always clean. I use to come here everyday and order something different almost everyday but I loved the pork fried rice. I just needed the fat cut off of it cause that how I enjoy it. Almost always ended up ordering that if I couldn't make up my mind. I guess the cook had a problem with it cause he took the time to chit chat with the servers at the front and mention my order like it was a big deal. Then as he walked back to the back passing me we made eye contact clearly letting clearly letting him know that I heard him. 
I'm a 5'9" 235lbs 36" waist Marine Corps Veteran with 4 deployments I can honestly say a lil bit of PTSD kicked in which almost led me to flip the table and stay a scene but I'm too old for that stuff.. so here I am typing away like a keyboard warrior because the other route would have most likely ended me up somewhere I don't need to be. Trust me I'm not proud of this. 
I sure hope the restaurant handles the situation with the cooks ignorance. Other then that The food is amazing and the place is clean. 3 stars though.. would've been 5 for sure.

So happy to have a ramen house in Southwest. Of course before coming in, we had to check out the yelp reviews and the menu. I was so excited to see chicken karaage on their menu! I had a karaage bowl and my husband had tonkotsu ramen. Their ramen is surprisingly good! It isn't salty like majority of ramen places. To our disappointment, karaage was just o.k. Nothing beats the original we have back in Japan. The chicken was very dry and lacking flavor. 

Food took a while to get to us but the guy who served us was very quick and attentive! I love the atmosphere! It felt like we were on the streets of Japan. Definitely coming back and recommending this place to friends and family. 

Finally! We won't have to drive all the way to Spring Mountain to get good ramen. Hopefully our future visits here will be just as good.

I was excited to find out a ramen place within 5 miles from home. Woohooo...
The place is spacious and clean. The decor is not too busy. I actually like the decor and ambience. 5/5 score.
The staff is 5/5, although she was by herself for 10mins(exluding kitchen staff). There were about 3 groups plus us, she did well in taking orders in a timely manner. 
Now for the food : ) 3/5 we had the tempura mix. Nothing fancy about that. 3.5/5 for the ramen. I had the spicy tonkutso miso. I was a little worried when i saw it. I thought it'll be super spicy. Not at all. It might be 4/10 spice level. But the ramen itself is good except for the bamboo shoot. I fished it all out. Nasty! Please use fresh ones. My hubby ordered the regular tonkutso ramen, i tried it. Just ok. He said he had better. Now for the black sesame ice cream... yum-O! 5/5!!!
Now, will i ever come back? Probably. If we're too lazy to go to chinatown.
Walking in, waiting, eating...I was giddy from joy the whole time! In love with the interior AND exterior design. The curry, onigiri, and pumpkin croquette were beautiful in every bite. Y'all rock!!!

My boyfriend told me this place is not so great but I wanted to try anyway. He was right. I should have listened to him. I had the worst Karaage and Gyudon. Karaage was soggy, beef did not have much flavor and portion was too small compare to rice. I am not picky but I would definitely say no to this place. We have so many great ramen places in Vegas anyway.

Big fan of this place. Love the lunch special and the poke bowls.  Super friendly staff, open late, and the prices are very reasonable. 

Highly recommended. Better for smaller groups as they don't have any large tables.

For appetizer my boyfriend and I got the squid maru and gyudon, both very delicious. He had curry hot noddle and I had the Katsu Don (comes with miso soup and salad) not sure what dressing they use for the salad but it was really good. Reason for the three stars: For the Katsu Don, they scramble the egg where as I would have preferred sunny side up. The Katsu had a soggy chicken nugget crust instead of a tradition crunchy one. Lastly, the meat to rice ratio was slightly off and I found myself with lots of leftover rice. Overall the location has really adorable decorations gives it a authentic look. Friendly staff. OMG you can not leave without trying the honey toast ! It's probably the best I've ever had EVER !

The food is OK but that's it it's just OK. Staff was super nice but the food for the price, I'll never return.  If they were even just a couple dollars cheaper on their entrées that might make a difference but for what you're getting and the price for pain it just is no value to it.

Spicy tonkotsu miso ramen, with corn, for the both of us, along with some garlic edamame. The edamame seems standard and very similar to the one at Bachi Burger (this isn't a complaint, as I very much enjoyed it). I'm not gonna lie, I never eat the chashu, so I don't even feel qualified to give an opinion. Sometimes when you order miso ramen, it comes out with a very thick broth, which I am not a fan of. This did not happen at Omoide, however. It was a good balance of spice and miso.

The decor here is very, very cute. The servers are nice and attentive. I hope Omoide does well because I'm interested in trying the other offerings!

This place is okay. I pass by this place on my way to work so I thought 'Oh cool, a place that my boyfriend and I can try!' 
Honestly, their stuff is a little overpriced... $2 for one rice ball? That's kind of ridiculous. The soup I expected to be about $9-$10, but the flavor wasn't all that great. We ordered takoyaki which is so much better at Ramen Tatsu. Something about the flavor was kind of off. I got the spicy tonkotsu miso and my boyfriend got the spicy tonkotsu. His soup was grainy... My noodles were really mushy. We don't like to complain when we're hungry, so I'm just warning you all out there that honestly, there's better choices out there. I'm glad I tried it because I can say that I'll be heading back over to Monta or Ramen Sora instead. It's a shame because I really wanted to like you guys. I do like that you guys offer a variety of food options, but the prices are definitely a turn off. *sad face*
My favorite place to eat!!! I'm obsessed with the Karaage chicken and cold noodle ume soba.
