For the past six months, I have heard nothing but excellent things about this restaurant from my best friend, so we came here with high expectations. It is suffice to say that our expectations were exceeded! 

Despite the fact that it was a Sunday afternoon, there were plenty of open seats. Upon walking in, we were immediately greeted and assigned to a seat. The menu holds so many options, whether you're feeling ramen or Japanese curry or appetizers or cold noodles. Its wide variety made me question my decision because everything looked so good (and I wasn't even hungry). 

The pricing is ridiculously good. Although we only ordered two mini dishes and an appetizer, we were filled up and the total ended up being lower than a fast food meal. There's no chicken option for the curry so I opted for a mini chicken curry bowl. It's pretty good sized and it was only $4! My boyfriend ordered the chasu bowl and a karage and was super satisfied with his meal as well. 

Our waiter was super attentive and knowledgeable too. He continuously checked up on us and filled out water cups. It's definitely a win-win when the service and food quality mirrors one another! To top of it off, there's a great ambiance and I would highly recommend this restaurant for lunch or dinner! We definitely see ourselves returning in the near future.

Not bad we liked the ramen but there was just one person working so we waited a while and she took the order of the people that were behind us first which I don't know why ... So the dinning experience wasn't very good but the Ramen was good... It's new so hopefully they get more workers... Not a lot of beverage options...

I went with my friend last week for the first time.i love their interior design, you can see they do spend some time on the design. However the ramen is not good. I ordered the shrimp tempura with ramen. When they serve the dish The tempura is already "melted" in the soup. The soup is not good either. The server is very nice though.

I've always wondered how this place tasted every time I would drive by it. It's next to all these amazing food spots so I decided to give it a try with some friends who were craving noodles and soup. 

I ordered the vegetarian soba noodles with the egg. We asked for the spice rack and they only have us 4 options and none of them were spicy. It's more savory and mild and it's nothing compared to Monta or any other ramen places. 

The ambiance is overall nice and they play some great tunes. I also noticed they do poke bowls which is interesting for an overall advertised noodle place.

We recently moved to this side of town and came across this restaurant. We've been there twice for Omoides lunch special. You can't beat it for quality and price!  For ONLY $12.00 you get a regular size bowl of ramen, a choice between three sides (Chashu Don is my favorite) and a drink. Oh, and both times we've had their vegetable tempora and both times we've gotten to try different vegetables.

I want to preface this review by saying that I eat all kinds of crazy stuff. I am an adventurous foodie and there's nothing I haven't tried.

After eating here, I got sooooo sick. And I NEVER get sick from food. I didn't like it when I was eating it. Something tasted off and I couldn't finish the bowl. 30 min later- I was done for

Not going to lie, when I walked in it straight up smelled like YUCK and I wanted to leave with the quickness. But, after we got seated the smell disappeared. I'm assuming someone let one rip before we entered. 

I ordered the salmon and avocado salad and that thing disappeared with the quickness. I could not stop eating it, it was delicious.  The salmon melted in my mouth and the avocado was perfectly ripe. I also ordered a Katsu pork bun. It was bigger than I thought it would be and was also taster than I thought it would be. It was so good we ordered two to go. The sauce on it wasn't overpowering and gave the bun a great taste. 

Lastly, of course we had to order the Honey Toast and we ordered it with black sesame ice cream although the waitress kept saying not to, and to order it with Vanilla ice cream instead. Welp, no we wanted black sesame AND guess what miss waitress it tasted like an orgasm in my mouth. The black sesame ice cream was delish, and that toast! My goodness soo goddam good. Order the Honey Toast even if your full. Because my friends its worth it.
Well worth it! Friendly service & pretty quick serving time. Came here 8:30 - 9:30 PM not too busy
Very authentic taste & also setting! Love the decor inside. Very friendly & attentive staff and the food was on point. Will definitely return to try more food.

This place I thought would be awesome like the Udon spot in Hawaii, but come to find out very disappointing. 

The reason why I say this is because the udon is not thick. It is pretty skinny for udon and also the meat portion on it is a joke. I ordered the curry broth which was very good actually, but it came with pork belly that was 3 small pieces. It was literally small as a strip of super thin bacon sliced into 3 pieces. 

The decor was on point and service. Just need to work on giving a little bit more meat in the portions.

My fiancé and I were in the mood for some Japanese food and decided to come here as it comes highly recommended from a good friend. We stopped in about 8pm on Saturday night - the place was busy, but we were seated immediately. That's where the goodness ends. 

We looked at the menus for a while - long enough for the people who came in behind us to be seated, get drinks and food. No one had come by to get our drink orders or even check us. Of course, I understand being busy, but at the very least any type of issue should have been communicated to us. 

After discussing how rude and unprofessional this is, we  decided to leave. If you can't be bothered with taking care of your customers and making them all feel welcome, we can't be bothered with dining at your establishment or recommending it to anyone. 

Went down the street to Bonsai and had a wonderful experience and meal.

Hands down best Japanese quality / value in Vegas.  Ramen, tuna tataki, salmon avocado salad and pork Katsu are amazing !

Huge menu and incredibly quality food prepared under the watchful guise of Naga-san, a super talented chef from Nagoya, Japan.
It was amazing!! Went a few months back and just came across the pic I took! So unbelievably tasty!!

Finally I don't have to drive to Chinatown, definitely excited about a ramen place opening on the Southwest part of town.  My fiancé ordered the spicy tonkotsu and it had the right amount of flavor to it.  I wish the karraage was a little more crispy, but that's a personal preference to me.   I ordered the katsu don,  once again not bad, just wish there was more flavor in the pork and rice so I just asked for hot sauce.  The part I dislike is that there are no descriptions or images, so we had to ask the server to explain things on the menu.  Another suggestion, have Yelp help you (thanks to the previous reviews and photos !!!)

The atmosphere/decor was super cute.    This is the primary reason it got an extra star  (just being honest).   The servers are attentive.  The food was good.  I think they could kick it up a notch with the flavoring, but with everything else I would definitely come back !!

I don't know why people gave not that good of a review for this place. My first impression when I walked in was "wow, what a cool looking little restaurant". Went here for dinner around 5pm, I was having cravings for some curry. I ordered the Ton Katsu Curry Don, it was about $10. Came with Miso soup and a side of salad with the combo, Not bad for a full meal. The chicken cutlet was crispy, and the curry sauce was tasty. I was still amazed with the ambience of this place. This restuarant is located where I call "little Chinatown" next to Oyhsi on Rainbow Blvd Rd. 

Will come back again to try many more of their items like their karaage chicken plate. Will recommend to my friends looking for a quick bite of curry, they won't disappoint. Service was decent but never gave me a bad experience.

I had the tonkotsu shoyu ramen and the broth does not taste like ramen broth. The beef onigiri tasted old and the rice was too. The restaurant itself has a nice design. That's it. I wouldn't eat ramen here again unless i was really desperate.

Excellent food.... curry is good and service is great!!

 Came here three days in a row food is consistent and everything's good
Come for the lunch special!! Its the best deal in town if you ask me! Delicious and its a steal! I was so full but i knew if i stopped eating id regret it. I'll definitely be back!

so happy there is a decent ramen place in the southwest. noodles could be better and the chashu could be softer in comparison to other great ramen spots, but it's a great fix for any craving. huge place so waiting time shouldn't be a problem. workers are very nice.

will change review once i try other things on their menu.
Awesome place! It's so nicely decorated inside, and a very friendly server. The food was great!

Service was sort of abrupt - not rude, but not terribly attentive either. I tipped only 15%

The food was average - the udon soup was a little bland but edible. My son got the gyoza and he liked them so much he ordered a second serving. We had a very simple meal.

The atmosphere doesn't scream "party spot" but then again it's 9 PM on a Sunday night. Might be more hopping during weekends or happy hours. 

Overall, there isn't anything spectacular about this place but there's also nothing wrong with it either.

Stumbled upon a new favorite!

Omoide (???, Japanese for "memories") is perfectly located on Rainbow blvd. to catch our attention enough to draw us in.  We were actually on the way to another spot, and because I don't often find myself in this part of town, I just had to try.  

Once inside, the center ceiling lights will catch your eye, then you look around and now find yourself outside a Japanese village. From the building designs on the wall, the windows decorated like awnings, and the seated-bar section like a street cart, the interior decor is beautifully crafted atmosphere.

Like the name says, they serve poke bowls and variations of Japanese noodles.  Today I'm having an appetizer with ramen.  Next time I need to try the poke, or even the udon or soba (which are two of my other favorite Japanese noodles, not found often in Vegas).  

Karaage ($5.50) - Japanese-style fried chicken bites.  Great but a little thin on the fry imo.

Tonkotsu ($7.50) - a classic bowl which every ramen spot offers.  Omoide's version nails it.  Thin noodles, flavorful broth, no overwheming oil, and compared to other ramen joints, at a good price.

The end result was a delicious experience by means of a surprising stumble.  I'm glad I found this place.  When I'm back in the area, I want to go straight to Omoide.

Been here 5xs now. 
Dined in 4xs and took take out tonight at midnight because no one else was open. 

Customer service is awful. No personality and seem stressed being the only one on the floor. 

I ordered the shrimp don and my mom ordered the tempura udon. Both were awful. I asked for udon noodles and we got home and found out we had cold soba noodles in a cold square instead hot udon. 

Won't be back. 
Best to dine in.

1 Star for late night hours.

Nice place. But never had Japanese food before. It would be very helpful if they had English speaking waitresses there.  Because I need an explanation what the food is, what kind of meat, how is it prepared. It's very hard to pick something off the menu when u do Not get a good explanation.  Maybe I got the only non english speaking one.

I'm always looking for a late night restaurant and this one fits the bill open till 1 am on most nights.  I love the curry bowl and the curry noodle bowl with pork belly.  The menu now includes the ever popular poke bowl with some nice options at a reasonable price.  The atmosphere is upbeat and the decor is fun.
This place is pretty good. I like their selection of noodles like ramen, udon or soba. Cold or hot. I've had their soba cold noodles and their miso ramen and pretty good not bad..
the scenery inside is sensibly matches its Japanese food.  Presentations are good.  Tako yaki is good and the saimen sure wished i remembered what it was.  Apple the waitress was helpful.

Me and my husband have passed by this place several times and gave it a try today.
We had karaage appetizer, ten-don (tempura donburi) and tonkotsu ramen.

My husband has been on a search for good tonkotsu, and we are happy to say this place filled his needs! I cannot speak for him, but the chashu was tender, broth was perfect and came with thin noodles as it should (according to him).

My tendon came with 3 shrimps, nasu, shishito, kabocha (pumpkin) and a perfect hanjyuku-tamago (egg)!!  It was a double thumbs up for not only having potato croquette but also having pumpkin croquette!! Oh, and Orion beer of course. 

Their interior is amazing, and almost reminded us of a yatai, and gives the ambiance of sitting outdoor.  Clean overall, and the staff was extremely lovely with the smiles. :) 

We hope to come back this week!!!

I went here, and after a short wait of about ten minutes I was seated.  We were lucky and beat the crowd.  Unlike others, the service was very fast.  The decor is like being in an out door street alley in Japan.  I liked the feel of it.  It kind of takes you away.  Decor A.  I got tonkotsu ramen.  The broth and noodles I'd give a B+, but they need to work on their toppings.  The Chasu, egg, and everything was good, but the bamboo tasted like the canned type.  If your you're going to use canned bamboo then just don't.  Also, they put what appeared to be saffron on top as well.  They could do without that.  Just keep it simple and yummy.  No need to make it fancy.
Over all I like this place, but it seems to have a polerizing effect on people.  People either love it or hate it.  Hopefully that keeps it from getting to Monta's crowd level.  I still think Monta is the best in town.

This place is an in between-er. There was a few things I liked a lot but the others were ehh. Let's start with the bad ones. The tonkatsu don was okay. It didn't taste special or anything. The Tonkatsu sauce was already on the meat which made it soggy. I recommend asking for the sauce in the side. The miso soup was one of the worst I've ever tasted, mostly because it tasted like hot water. 

On the upside, we ordered the Buta shio buttkake and it's amazing! In fact, we loved it so much that we ordered a side of noodles to add to the broth. The sesame ice cream was also one of the best I've ever tasted. I'll definitely get a scoop every time I go. 

We wanted to start with the gyoza but the waitress forgot to ring it in, I guess. We didn't feel like eating it anymore. 

I guess if you're gonna go here, try the Buta shio buttkake and the tonkatsu with sauce on the side!

My friend and I like to meet up as often as we can to grab a bite and chat at a new dining spot. 

We arrived around 6 and it was empty. I had low expectations but even those were not met. I ordered the ten don and my friend got the chashu bowl.

The food came out very quickly, almost too quickly, like it was just sitting there. My friend and I were both disappointed by the small portions. I didn't enjoy anything in my bowl. The tempura was soggy and unappetizing and the rice was gummy. My friend was unimpressed with her meal as well.

Once we finished eating we both mentioned how we still felt a little hungry but didn't have any desire to order more food. She even discussed what she planned on reheating from her previous night's leftovers that she had at home... 

I don't have any desire to return to Omoide.

I have always love ramen and so I try this place for the second time and order the spicy ramen and love it!! The broth is delicious and not salty. Most of ramen place are highly salty. I do recommend everyone should try them. 
Very friendly staff and had a beautiful decor lanterns. Stop by and give it a try!!!!

On the outside you may think this is a chain restaurant but don't be fooled.  This place is an authentic JAPANESE restaurant with amazing quality and variety.  A little hidden and secret place-- we loved this place so much my husband went on Wednesday this week and returned on Saturday.  Having visited Japan many times, we can spot an authentic Japanese restaurant-- not just one that caters to Americans with their offering of hundreds of rolls (with mozzarella and everything fried).  Prices are amazing-- like Happy Hour price but offered all the time.  AND amazingly enough, they offer 2 for 1 Beer and house Sake AFTER 7-- yep after NOT before.  First time on Thursday -  we ordered the garlic edamame (on point), tuna tataki (fresh and delicious with fried garlic on top) and the tonkotsu ramen.  It may sound like they may offer too many different items to be good but not so.  The Ramen was probably one of the best I've had here since I moved here 3 months ago and I have gone to specialty Ramen only places.  The broth was rich but light and the noodles were the right amount of chewiness.  The noodles tasted homemade.  The pork actually had a grilled quality to it that most other ramen places do not have.  Now, I know where to go to satisfy my ramen crave.  One of the best buys is the buns.  They are only $2.50 and they are huge.  We tried the Pork Katsu ones and the pork was so flavorful, crunchy and melted in your mouth.  It was so good we had to order one more.  This is a must try.

Tonight - Saturday night - we went back.  We started with the Avocado Salmon Salad and it was the bomb.  With a light Yuzu dressing, lots of fresh Salmon sashimi and generous avocado , it was a price steal at 8 bucks!  We also had the Black Cod and grilled squid.  We have been to premier yakatori places in Northern Ca and this squid was better than any I have ever had.  Delicious, fresh and tender-- definitely another must try!  The Miso Black Cod was also flavorful and tender -- yum!  We also tried the Udon-- again amazing light, flavorful broth and satisfyingly chewy fresh udon.  We met the Japanese chef, Nagasan.  He was so polite and friendly.  The service is also very friendly and helpful.  Kevin helped us with both visits. Go try this secret, hidden gem.  You won't be disappointed.  I promise!

First off I want to say how happy I am for such a great ramen place to be so close to home. 

As soon as you walk in you'll notice the detailed decor. It's super cute and very well planned out. It reminds me of a little Japanese village you might see illustrated in a book or in a old Japanese film. It's not just the counter seating but if you look up you will see the lanterns and the set up they have in the nooks of the walls. 

Then there's the food. I love most things spicy so when I first came I ordered the spicy tonkatsu miso ramen with an egg even though you have to order it separately, I gotta have an egg. Lol That was delicious and now here for the second time I couldn't wait to have it again. It's not spicy to where you can't enjoy your meal. It's just the right amount of spice, because they know that's why you ordered it. I love the noodles, always soft and just the right size. The toppings in the ramen are what make the broth more flavorful. As you eat you can taste all the different things but at the same time nothing over powers another. We also tried the umeboshi Onigiri, which is pickled plum inside a rice ball. This brought me back to my grandmother. Being raised in a Japanese house, when we were sick we were given umeboshi Onigiri and tea, it brought back memories. We also ordered the gyoza, honestly it's nothing to be excited about. It's a fried pot sticker, something I feel you can make at home. 

My overall feel for this place is amazing. Love, love, love it!! The waitresses are super nice and very friendly. Always making sure everything is alright and filling up your cup. Brought my brother back this time only for him to love it too. I will continue to be coming back and bringing more people.

I was pretty disappointed with the service and some of their food. When we came the server seemed super flustered and was rushing us as we were ordering our food. We did have a few questions about some foods because the menu didn't really explain what some of the dishes contained. 

One of our friends asked if he could try their curry sauce and the waitress looked confused about why he wanted to taste it. He had to explain that he wanted to taste it so he could decide whether he would choose a dish that contained the curry and she just nodded left and came back a few minutes later with the curry. The curry was watery and not as thick as other restaurants make it.

My husband and I got the takoyaki, salmon avocado salad, and Ebi fry don. The Ebi fry was okay. It was kind of chewy and may have been fried a little too much. The salmon was good and the takoyaki was okay. 

As we ended our meal the waitress took her time to come to us and hand us our bills. This was a change from her rushing us and I personally didn't like how much of a difference her attitude changed from the beginning of our meal to the end.
